midas/src/system.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /********************************************************************\
00002 
00003   Name:         system.c
00004   Created by:   Stefan Ritt
00005 
00006   Contents:     All operating system dependent system services. This
00007                 file containt routines which hide all system specific
00008                 behaviour to higher levels. This is done by con-
00009                 ditional compiling using the OS_xxx variable defined
00010                 in MIDAS.H.
00011 
00012                 Details about interprocess communication can be
00013                 found in "UNIX distributed programming" by Chris
00014                 Brown, Prentice Hall
00015 
00016   ** muCap patches **
00017   - Disabled ss_tape_get_blockn() since our tape drives seem to return
00018     garbage when asked for the block number.
00019

00340 static INT ss_in_async_routine_flag = 0;
00341 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
00342 #include <signal.h>
00343 
00344 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00345 /* globals */
00346 
00347 /* if set, don't write to *SHM file (used for Linux cluster) */
00348 BOOL disable_shm_write = FALSE;

00350 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00351 INT ss_set_async_flag(INT flag)
00352 /********************************************************************\
00353 
00354   Routine: ss_set_async_flag
00355 
00356   Purpose: Sets the ss_in_async_routine_flag according to the flag
00357      value. This is necessary when semaphore operations under
00358      UNIX are called inside an asynchrounous routine (via alarm)
00359      because they then behave different.
00360 
00361   Input:
00362     INT  flag               May be 1 or 0
00363 
00364   Output:
00365     none
00366 
00367   Function value:
00368     INT                     Previous value of the flag
00369 
00370 \********************************************************************/
00371 {
00372    INT old_flag;
00373 
00374    old_flag = ss_in_async_routine_flag;
00375    ss_in_async_routine_flag = flag;
00376    return old_flag;
00377 }
00378 
00379 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00380 INT ss_shm_open(char *name, INT size, void **adr, HNDLE * handle)
00381 /********************************************************************\
00382 
00383   Routine: ss_shm_open
00384 
00385   Purpose: Create a shared memory region which can be seen by several
00386      processes which know the name.
00387 
00388   Input:
00389     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00390     INT  size               Initial size of the shared memory in bytes
00391                             if .SHM file doesn't exist
00392 
00393   Output:
00394     void  *adr              Address of opened shared memory
00395     HNDLE handle            Handle or key to the shared memory
00396 
00397   Function value:
00398     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00399     SS_CREATED              Shared memory was created
00400     SS_FILE_ERROR           Paging file cannot be created
00401     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
00402 
00403 \********************************************************************/
00404 {
00405    INT status;
00406    char mem_name[256], file_name[256], path[256];
00407 
00408    /* Add a leading SM_ to the memory name */
00409    sprintf(mem_name, "SM_%s", name);
00410 
00411    /* Build the filename out of the path, and the name of the shared memory. */
00412    cm_get_path(path);
00413    if (path[0] == 0) {
00414       getcwd(path, 256);
00415 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00416 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00417       strcat(path, "/");
00418 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00419       strcat(path, "\\");
00420 #endif
00421    }
00422 
00423    strcpy(file_name, path);
00424 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00425    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
00426 #endif
00427    strcat(file_name, name);
00428    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
00429 
00430 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00431 
00432    status = SS_SUCCESS;
00433 
00434    {
00435       HANDLE hFile, hMap;
00436       char str[256], *p;
00437       DWORD file_size;
00438 
00439       /* make the memory name unique using the pathname. This is necessary
00440          because NT doesn't use ftok. So if different experiments are
00441          running in different directories, they should not see the same
00442          shared memory */
00443       strcpy(str, path);
00444 
00445       /* replace special chars by '*' */
00446       while (strpbrk(str, "\\: "))
00447          *strpbrk(str, "\\: ") = '*';
00448       strcat(str, mem_name);
00449 
00450       /* convert to uppercase */
00451       p = str;
00452       while (*p)
00453          *p++ = (char) toupper(*p);
00454 
00455       hMap = OpenFileMapping(FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, FALSE, str);
00456       if (hMap == 0) {
00457          hFile = CreateFile(file_name, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
00458                             FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE, NULL,
00459                             OPEN_ALWAYS, FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL, 0);
00460          if (!hFile) {
00461             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "CreateFile() failed");
00462             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00463          }
00464 
00465          file_size = GetFileSize(hFile, NULL);
00466          if (file_size != 0xFFFFFFFF && file_size > 0)
00467             size = file_size;
00468 
00469          hMap = CreateFileMapping(hFile, NULL, PAGE_READWRITE, 0, size, str);
00470 
00471          if (!hMap) {
00472             status = GetLastError();
00473             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "CreateFileMapping() failed, error %d", status);
00474             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00475          }
00476 
00477          CloseHandle(hFile);
00478          status = SS_CREATED;
00479       }
00480 
00481       *adr = MapViewOfFile(hMap, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, 0);
00482       *handle = (HNDLE) hMap;
00483 
00484       if (adr == NULL) {
00485          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "MapViewOfFile() failed");
00486          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00487       }
00488 
00489       return status;
00490    }
00491 
00492 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00493 #ifdef OS_VMS
00494 
00495    status = SS_SUCCESS;
00496 
00497    {
00498       int addr[2];
00499       $DESCRIPTOR(memname_dsc, "dummy");
00500       $DESCRIPTOR(filename_dsc, "dummy");
00501       memname_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(mem_name);
00502       memname_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = mem_name;
00503       filename_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(file_name);
00504       filename_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = file_name;
00505 
00506       addr[0] = size;
00507       addr[1] = 0;
00508 
00509       status = ppl$create_shared_memory(&memname_dsc, addr, &PPL$M_NOUNI, &filename_dsc);
00510 
00511       if (status == PPL$_CREATED)
00512          status = SS_CREATED;
00513       else if (status != PPL$_NORMAL)
00514          status = SS_FILE_ERROR;
00515 
00516       *adr = (void *) addr[1];
00517       *handle = 0;              /* not used under VMS */
00518 
00519       if (adr == NULL)
00520          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00521 
00522       return status;
00523    }
00524 
00525 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00526 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00527 
00528    status = SS_SUCCESS;
00529 
00530    {
00531       int key, shmid, fh, file_size;
00532       struct shmid_ds buf;
00533 
00534       /* create a unique key from the file name */
00535       key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
00536 
00537       /* if file doesn't exist, create it */
00538       if (key == -1) {
00539          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_TRUNC | O_BINARY, 0644);
00540          close(fh);
00541          key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
00542 
00543          if (key == -1) {
00544             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "ftok() failed");
00545             return SS_FILE_ERROR;
00546          }
00547 
00548          status = SS_CREATED;
00549 
00550          /* delete any previously created memory */
00551 
00552          shmid = shmget(key, 0, 0);
00553          shmctl(shmid, IPC_RMID, &buf);
00554       } else {
00555          /* if file exists, retrieve its size */
00556          file_size = (INT) ss_file_size(file_name);
00557          if (file_size > 0)
00558             size = file_size;
00559       }
00560 
00561       /* get the shared memory, create if not existing */
00562       shmid = shmget(key, size, 0);
00563       if (shmid == -1) {
00564          //cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_shm_open", "Creating shared memory segment, key: 0x%x, size: %d",key,size);
00565          shmid = shmget(key, size, IPC_CREAT|IPC_EXCL);
00566          if (shmid == -1 && errno == EEXIST)
00567            {
00568              cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "Shared memory segment with key 0x%x already exists, please remove it manually: ipcrm -M 0x%x",key,key);
00569              return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00570            }
00571          status = SS_CREATED;
00572       }
00573 
00574       if (shmid == -1) {
00575          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open", "shmget(key=0x%x,size=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)", key, size, errno, strerror(errno));
00576          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00577       }
00578 
00579       buf.shm_perm.uid = getuid();
00580       buf.shm_perm.gid = getgid();
00581       buf.shm_perm.mode = 0666;
00582       shmctl(shmid, IPC_SET, &buf);
00583 
00584       *adr = shmat(shmid, 0, 0);
00585       *handle = (HNDLE) shmid;
00586 
00587       if ((*adr) == (void *) (-1)) {
00588          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_open","shmat(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)", shmid, errno, strerror(errno));
00589          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00590       }
00591 
00592       /* if shared memory was created, try to load it from file */
00593       if (status == SS_CREATED) {
00594          fh = open(file_name, O_RDONLY, 0644);
00595          if (fh == -1)
00596             fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT | O_RDWR, 0644);
00597          else
00598             read(fh, *adr, size);
00599          close(fh);
00600       }
00601 
00602       return status;
00603    }
00604 
00605 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
00606 }
00607 
00608 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00609 INT ss_shm_close(char *name, void *adr, HNDLE handle, INT destroy_flag)
00610 /********************************************************************\
00611 
00612   Routine: ss_shm_close
00613 
00614   Purpose: Close a shared memory region.
00615 
00616   Input:
00617     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00618     void *adr               Base address of shared memory
00619     HNDLE handle            Handle of shared memeory
00620     BOOL destroy            Shared memory has to be destroyd and
00621           flushed to the mapping file.
00622 
00623   Output:
00624     none
00625 
00626   Function value:
00627     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00628     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
00629     SS_FILE_ERROR           Cannot write shared memory file
00630     SS_INVALID_HANDLE       Invalid shared memory handle
00631 
00632 \********************************************************************/
00633 {
00634    char mem_name[256], file_name[256], path[256];
00635 
00636    /*
00637       append a leading SM_ to the memory name to resolve name conflicts
00638       with mutex or semaphore names
00639     */
00640    sprintf(mem_name, "SM_%s", name);
00641 
00642    /* append .SHM and preceed the path for the shared memory file name */
00643    cm_get_path(path);
00644    if (path[0] == 0) {
00645       getcwd(path, 256);
00646 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00647 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00648       strcat(path, "/");
00649 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00650       strcat(path, "\\");
00651 #endif
00652    }
00653 
00654    strcpy(file_name, path);
00655 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00656    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
00657 #endif
00658    strcat(file_name, name);
00659    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
00660 
00661 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00662 
00663    if (!UnmapViewOfFile(adr))
00664       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00665 
00666    CloseHandle((HANDLE) handle);
00667 
00668    return SS_SUCCESS;
00669 
00670 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00671 #ifdef OS_VMS
00672 /* outcommented because ppl$delete... makes privilege violation
00673   {
00674   int addr[2], flags, status;
00675   char mem_name[100];
00676   $DESCRIPTOR(memname_dsc, mem_name);
00677 
00678   strcpy(mem_name, "SM_");
00679   strcat(mem_name, name);
00680   memname_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(mem_name);
00681 
00682   flags = PPL$M_FLUSH | PPL$M_NOUNI;
00683 
00684   addr[0] = 0;
00685   addr[1] = adr;
00686 
00687   status = ppl$delete_shared_memory( &memname_dsc, addr, &flags);
00688 
00689   if (status == PPL$_NORMAL)
00690     return SS_SUCCESS;
00691 
00692   return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00693   }
00694 */
00695    return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00696 
00697 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00698 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00699 
00700    {
00701       struct shmid_ds buf;
00702       FILE *fh;
00703 
00704       /* get info about shared memory */
00705       if (shmctl(handle, IPC_STAT, &buf) < 0) {
00706          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmctl(shmid=%d,IPC_STAT) failed, errno %d (%s)",handle,errno,strerror(errno));
00707          return SS_INVALID_HANDLE;
00708       }
00709 
00710       /* copy to file and destroy if we are the last one */
00711       if (buf.shm_nattch == 1) {
00712          if (!disable_shm_write) {
00713             fh = fopen(file_name, "w");
00714 
00715             if (fh == NULL) {
00716                cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close",
00717                       "Cannot write to file %s, please check protection", file_name);
00718             } else {
00719                /* write shared memory to file */
00720                fwrite(adr, 1, buf.shm_segsz, fh);
00721                fclose(fh);
00722             }
00723          }
00724 
00725          if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
00726             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmdt(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)",handle,errno,strerror(errno));
00727             return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00728          }
00729 
00730          if (shmctl(handle, IPC_RMID, &buf) < 0) {
00731             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmctl(shmid=%d,IPC_RMID) failed, errno %d (%s)",handle,errno,strerror(errno));
00732             return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00733          }
00734       } else
00735          /* only detach if we are not the last */
00736       if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
00737          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_close", "shmdt(shmid=%d) failed, errno %d (%s)",handle,errno,strerror(errno));
00738          return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00739       }
00740 
00741       return SS_SUCCESS;
00742    }
00743 
00744 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
00745 }
00746 
00747 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00748 INT ss_shm_protect(HNDLE handle, void *adr)
00749 /********************************************************************\
00750 
00751   Routine: ss_shm_protect
00752 
00753   Purpose: Protect a shared memory region, disallow read and write
00754            access to it by this process
00755 
00756   Input:
00757     HNDLE handle            Handle of shared memeory
00758     void  *adr              Address of shared memory
00759 
00760   Output:
00761     none
00762 
00763   Function value:
00764     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00765     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
00766 
00767 \********************************************************************/
00768 {
00769 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00770 
00771    if (!UnmapViewOfFile(adr))
00772       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00773 
00774 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00775 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00776 
00777    if (shmdt(adr) < 0) {
00778       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_protect", "shmdt() failed");
00779       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00780    }
00781 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
00782    return SS_SUCCESS;
00783 }
00784 
00785 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00786 INT ss_shm_unprotect(HNDLE handle, void **adr)
00787 /********************************************************************\
00788 
00789   Routine: ss_shm_unprotect
00790 
00791   Purpose: Unprotect a shared memory region so that it can be accessed
00792            by this process
00793 
00794   Input:
00795     HNDLE handle            Handle or key to the shared memory, must
00796                             be obtained with ss_shm_open
00797 
00798   Output:
00799     void  *adr              Address of opened shared memory
00800 
00801   Function value:
00802     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00803     SS_NO_MEMORY            Memory mapping failed
00804 
00805 \********************************************************************/
00806 {
00807 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00808 
00809    *adr = MapViewOfFile((HANDLE) handle, FILE_MAP_ALL_ACCESS, 0, 0, 0);
00810 
00811    if (*adr == NULL) {
00812       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_unprotect", "MapViewOfFile() failed");
00813       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00814    }
00815 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00816 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00817 
00818    *adr = shmat(handle, 0, 0);
00819 
00820    if ((*adr) == (void *) (-1)) {
00821       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_unprotect", "shmat() failed, errno = %d", errno);
00822       return SS_NO_MEMORY;
00823    }
00824 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
00825 
00826    return SS_SUCCESS;
00827 }
00828 
00829 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00830 INT ss_shm_flush(char *name, void *adr, INT size)
00831 /********************************************************************\
00832 
00833   Routine: ss_shm_flush
00834 
00835   Purpose: Flush a shared memory region to its disk file.
00836 
00837   Input:
00838     char *name              Name of the shared memory
00839     void *adr               Base address of shared memory
00840     INT  size               Size of shared memeory
00841 
00842   Output:
00843     none
00844 
00845   Function value:
00846     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
00847     SS_INVALID_ADDRESS      Invalid base address
00848 
00849 \********************************************************************/
00850 {
00851    char mem_name[256], file_name[256], path[256];
00852 
00853    /*
00854       append a leading SM_ to the memory name to resolve name conflicts
00855       with mutex or semaphore names
00856     */
00857    sprintf(mem_name, "SM_%s", name);
00858 
00859    /* append .SHM and preceed the path for the shared memory file name */
00860    cm_get_path(path);
00861    if (path[0] == 0) {
00862       getcwd(path, 256);
00863 #if defined(OS_VMS)
00864 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
00865       strcat(path, "/");
00866 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
00867       strcat(path, "\\");
00868 #endif
00869    }
00870 
00871    strcpy(file_name, path);
00872 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
00873    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
00874 #endif
00875    strcat(file_name, name);
00876    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
00877 
00878 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00879 
00880    if (!FlushViewOfFile(adr, size))
00881       return SS_INVALID_ADDRESS;
00882 
00883    return SS_SUCCESS;
00884 
00885 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00886 #ifdef OS_VMS
00887 
00888    return SS_SUCCESS;
00889 
00890 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00891 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00892 
00893    if (!disable_shm_write) {
00894       FILE *fh;
00895 
00896       fh = fopen(file_name, "w");
00897 
00898       if (fh == NULL) {
00899          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_shm_flush",
00900                 "Cannot write to file %s, please check protection", file_name);
00901       } else {
00902          /* write shared memory to file */
00903          fwrite(adr, 1, size, fh);
00904          fclose(fh);
00905       }
00906    }
00907    return SS_SUCCESS;
00908 
00909 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
00910 }
00911 
00912 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00913 INT ss_getthandle(void)
00914 /********************************************************************\
00915 
00916   Routine: ss_getthandle
00917 
00918   Purpose: Return thread handle of current thread
00919 
00920   Input:
00921     none
00922 
00923   Output:
00924     none
00925 
00926   Function value:
00927     INT thread handle
00928 
00929 \********************************************************************/
00930 {
00931 #ifdef OS_WINNT
00932    HANDLE hThread;
00933 
00934    /*
00935       Under Windows NT, it's a little bit tricky to get a thread handle
00936       which can be passed to other processes. First the calling process
00937       has to duplicate the GetCurrentThread() handle, then the process
00938       which gets this handle also has to use DuplicateHandle with the
00939       target process as its own. Then this duplicated handle can be used
00940       to the SupendThread() and ResumeThread() functions.
00941     */
00942 
00943    DuplicateHandle(GetCurrentProcess(), GetCurrentThread(),
00944                    GetCurrentProcess(), &hThread, THREAD_ALL_ACCESS, TRUE, 0);
00945 
00946    return (INT)hThread;
00947 
00948 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
00949 #ifdef OS_VMS
00950 
00951    return 0;
00952 
00953 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00954 #ifdef OS_UNIX
00955 
00956    return ss_getpid();
00957 
00958 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
00959 }
00960 
00961 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
00962 
00963 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00964 struct {
00965    char c;
00966    double d;
00967 } test_align;
00968 
00969 INT ss_get_struct_align()
00970 /********************************************************************\
00971 
00972   Routine: ss_get_struct_align
00973 
00974   Purpose: Returns compiler alignment of structures. In C, structures
00975      can be byte aligned, word or even quadword aligned. This
00976      can usually be set with compiler switches. This routine
00977      tests this alignment during runtime and returns 1 for
00978      byte alignment, 2 for word alignment, 4 for dword alignment
00979      and 8 for quadword alignment.
00980 
00981   Input:
00982     <none>
00983 
00984   Output:
00985     <none>
00986 
00987   Function value:
00988     INT    Structure alignment
00989 
00990 \********************************************************************/
00991 {
00992    return (PTYPE) (&test_align.d) - (PTYPE) & test_align.c;
00993 }
00994 
00995 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00996 INT ss_getpid(void)
00997 /********************************************************************\
00998 
00999   Routine: ss_getpid
01000 
01001   Purpose: Return process ID of current process
01002 
01003   Input:
01004     none
01005 
01006   Output:
01007     none
01008 
01009   Function value:
01010     INT              Process ID
01011 
01012 \********************************************************************/
01013 {
01014 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01015 
01016    return (int) GetCurrentProcessId();
01017 
01018 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01019 #ifdef OS_VMS
01020 
01021    return getpid();
01022 
01023 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01024 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01025 
01026    return getpid();
01027 
01028 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01029 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01030 
01031    return 0;
01032 
01033 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
01034 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01035 
01036    return 0;
01037 
01038 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
01039 }

01046 {
01047    _single_thread = TRUE;
01048 }
01049 
01050 INT ss_gettid(void)
01051 /********************************************************************\
01052 
01053   Routine: ss_ggettid
01054 
01055   Purpose: Return thread ID of current thread
01056 
01057   Input:
01058     none
01059 
01060   Output:
01061     none
01062 
01063   Function value:
01064     INT              thread ID
01065 
01066 \********************************************************************/
01067 {
01068    /* if forced to single thread mode, simply return fake TID */
01069    if (_single_thread)
01070       return 1;
01071 
01072 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01073 
01074    return 0;
01075 
01076 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
01077 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01078 
01079    return (int) GetCurrentThreadId();
01080 
01081 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01082 #ifdef OS_VMS
01083 
01084    return ss_getpid();
01085 
01086 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01087 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01088 
01089    return ss_getpid();
01090 
01091 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01092 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01093 
01094    return ss_getpid();
01095 
01096 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
01097 }

01099 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01100 
01101 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01102 void catch_sigchld(int signo)
01103 {
01104    int status;
01105 
01106    wait(&status);
01107    return;
01108 }
01109 #endif
01110 
01111 INT ss_spawnv(INT mode, char *cmdname, char *argv[])
01112 /********************************************************************\
01113 
01114   Routine: ss_spawnv
01115 
01116   Purpose: Spawn a subprocess or detached process
01117 
01118   Input:
01119     INT mode         One of the following modes:
01120            P_WAIT     Wait for the subprocess to compl.
01121            P_NOWAIT   Don't wait for subprocess to compl.
01122            P_DETACH   Create detached process.
01123     char cmdname     Program name to execute
01124     char *argv[]     Optional program arguments
01125 
01126   Output:
01127     none
01128 
01129   Function value:
01130     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01131     SS_INVALID_NAME  Command could not be executed;
01132 
01133 \********************************************************************/
01134 {
01135 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01136 
01137    if (spawnvp(mode, cmdname, argv) < 0)
01138       return SS_INVALID_NAME;
01139 
01140    return SS_SUCCESS;
01141 
01142 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01143 
01144 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01145 
01146    spawnvp((int) mode, cmdname, argv);
01147 
01148    return SS_SUCCESS;
01149 
01150 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
01151 
01152 #ifdef OS_VMS
01153 
01154    {
01155       char cmdstring[500], *pc;
01156       INT i, flags, status;
01157       va_list argptr;
01158 
01159       $DESCRIPTOR(cmdstring_dsc, "dummy");
01160 
01161       if (mode & P_DETACH) {
01162          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(cmdstring);
01163          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = cmdstring;
01164 
01165          status = sys$creprc(0, &cmdstring_dsc,
01166                              0, 0, 0, 0, 0, NULL, 4, 0, 0, PRC$M_DETACH);
01167       } else {
01168          flags = (mode & P_NOWAIT) ? 1 : 0;
01169 
01170          for (pc = argv[0] + strlen(argv[0]); *pc != ']' && pc != argv[0]; pc--);
01171          if (*pc == ']')
01172             pc++;
01173 
01174          strcpy(cmdstring, pc);
01175 
01176          if (strchr(cmdstring, ';'))
01177             *strchr(cmdstring, ';') = 0;
01178 
01179          strcat(cmdstring, " ");
01180 
01181          for (i = 1; argv[i] != NULL; i++) {
01182             strcat(cmdstring, argv[i]);
01183             strcat(cmdstring, " ");
01184          }
01185 
01186          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(cmdstring);
01187          cmdstring_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = cmdstring;
01188 
01189          status = lib$spawn(&cmdstring_dsc, 0, 0, &flags, NULL, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
01190       }
01191 
01192       return BM_SUCCESS;
01193    }
01194 
01195 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01196 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01197    pid_t child_pid;
01198 
01199 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
01200    union wait *status;
01201 #else
01202    int status;
01203 #endif
01204 
01205    if ((child_pid = fork()) < 0)
01206       return (-1);
01207 
01208    if (child_pid == 0) {
01209       /* now we are in the child process ... */
01210       child_pid = execvp(cmdname, argv);
01211       return SS_SUCCESS;
01212    } else {
01213       /* still in parent process */
01214       if (mode == P_WAIT)
01215 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
01216          waitpid(child_pid, status, WNOHANG);
01217 #else
01218          waitpid(child_pid, &status, WNOHANG);
01219 #endif
01220 
01221       else
01222          /* catch SIGCHLD signal to avoid <defunc> processes */
01223          signal(SIGCHLD, catch_sigchld);
01224    }
01225 
01226    return SS_SUCCESS;
01227 
01228 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01229 }
01230 
01231 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01232 INT ss_shell(int sock)
01233 /********************************************************************\
01234 
01235   Routine: ss_shell
01236 
01237   Purpose: Execute shell via socket (like telnetd)
01238 
01239   Input:
01240     int  sock        Socket
01241 
01242   Output:
01243     none
01244 
01245   Function value:
01246     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01247 
01248 \********************************************************************/
01249 {
01250 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01251 
01252    HANDLE hChildStdinRd, hChildStdinWr, hChildStdinWrDup,
01253        hChildStdoutRd, hChildStdoutWr,
01254        hChildStderrRd, hChildStderrWr, hSaveStdin, hSaveStdout, hSaveStderr;
01255 
01256    SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES saAttr;
01257    PROCESS_INFORMATION piProcInfo;
01258    STARTUPINFO siStartInfo;
01259    char buffer[256], cmd[256];
01260    DWORD dwRead, dwWritten, dwAvail, i, i_cmd;
01261    fd_set readfds;
01262    struct timeval timeout;
01263 
01264    /* Set the bInheritHandle flag so pipe handles are inherited. */
01265    saAttr.nLength = sizeof(SECURITY_ATTRIBUTES);
01266    saAttr.bInheritHandle = TRUE;
01267    saAttr.lpSecurityDescriptor = NULL;
01268 
01269    /* Save the handle to the current STDOUT. */
01270    hSaveStdout = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
01271 
01272    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDOUT. */
01273    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStdoutRd, &hChildStdoutWr, &saAttr, 0))
01274       return 0;
01275 
01276    /* Set a write handle to the pipe to be STDOUT. */
01277    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE, hChildStdoutWr))
01278       return 0;
01279 
01280 
01281    /* Save the handle to the current STDERR. */
01282    hSaveStderr = GetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE);
01283 
01284    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDERR. */
01285    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStderrRd, &hChildStderrWr, &saAttr, 0))
01286       return 0;
01287 
01288    /* Set a read handle to the pipe to be STDERR. */
01289    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE, hChildStderrWr))
01290       return 0;
01291 
01292 
01293    /* Save the handle to the current STDIN. */
01294    hSaveStdin = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
01295 
01296    /* Create a pipe for the child's STDIN. */
01297    if (!CreatePipe(&hChildStdinRd, &hChildStdinWr, &saAttr, 0))
01298       return 0;
01299 
01300    /* Set a read handle to the pipe to be STDIN. */
01301    if (!SetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE, hChildStdinRd))
01302       return 0;
01303 
01304    /* Duplicate the write handle to the pipe so it is not inherited. */
01305    if (!DuplicateHandle(GetCurrentProcess(), hChildStdinWr, GetCurrentProcess(), &hChildStdinWrDup, 0, FALSE,   /* not inherited */
01306                         DUPLICATE_SAME_ACCESS))
01307       return 0;
01308 
01309    CloseHandle(hChildStdinWr);
01310 
01311    /* Now create the child process. */
01312    memset(&siStartInfo, 0, sizeof(siStartInfo));
01313    siStartInfo.cb = sizeof(STARTUPINFO);
01314    siStartInfo.lpReserved = NULL;
01315    siStartInfo.lpReserved2 = NULL;
01316    siStartInfo.cbReserved2 = 0;
01317    siStartInfo.lpDesktop = NULL;
01318    siStartInfo.dwFlags = 0;
01319 
01320    if (!CreateProcess(NULL, "cmd /Q",   /* command line */
01321                       NULL,     /* process security attributes */
01322                       NULL,     /* primary thread security attributes */
01323                       TRUE,     /* handles are inherited */
01324                       0,        /* creation flags */
01325                       NULL,     /* use parent's environment */
01326                       NULL,     /* use parent's current directory */
01327                       &siStartInfo,     /* STARTUPINFO pointer */
01328                       &piProcInfo))     /* receives PROCESS_INFORMATION */
01329       return 0;
01330 
01331    /* After process creation, restore the saved STDIN and STDOUT. */
01332    SetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE, hSaveStdin);
01333    SetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE, hSaveStdout);
01334    SetStdHandle(STD_ERROR_HANDLE, hSaveStderr);
01335 
01336    i_cmd = 0;
01337 
01338    do {
01339       /* query stderr */
01340       do {
01341          if (!PeekNamedPipe(hChildStderrRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, &dwAvail, NULL))
01342             break;
01343 
01344          if (dwRead > 0) {
01345             ReadFile(hChildStderrRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01346             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01347          }
01348       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01349 
01350       /* query stdout */
01351       do {
01352          if (!PeekNamedPipe(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, &dwAvail, NULL))
01353             break;
01354          if (dwRead > 0) {
01355             ReadFile(hChildStdoutRd, buffer, 256, &dwRead, NULL);
01356             send(sock, buffer, dwRead, 0);
01357          }
01358       } while (dwAvail > 0);
01359 
01360 
01361       /* check if subprocess still alive */
01362       if (!GetExitCodeProcess(piProcInfo.hProcess, &i))
01363          break;
01364       if (i != STILL_ACTIVE)
01365          break;
01366 
01367       /* query network socket */
01368       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01369       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01370       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
01371       timeout.tv_usec = 100;
01372       select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
01373 
01374       if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01375          i = recv(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01376          if (i <= 0)
01377             break;
01378 
01379          /* backspace */
01380          if (cmd[i_cmd] == 8) {
01381             if (i_cmd > 0) {
01382                send(sock, "\b \b", 3, 0);
01383                i_cmd -= 1;
01384             }
01385          } else if (cmd[i_cmd] >= ' ' || cmd[i_cmd] == 13 || cmd[i_cmd] == 10) {
01386             send(sock, cmd + i_cmd, 1, 0);
01387             i_cmd += i;
01388          }
01389       }
01390 
01391       /* linefeed triggers new command */
01392       if (cmd[i_cmd - 1] == 10) {
01393          WriteFile(hChildStdinWrDup, cmd, i_cmd, &dwWritten, NULL);
01394          i_cmd = 0;
01395       }
01396 
01397    } while (TRUE);
01398 
01399    CloseHandle(hChildStdinWrDup);
01400    CloseHandle(hChildStdinRd);
01401    CloseHandle(hChildStderrRd);
01402    CloseHandle(hChildStdoutRd);
01403 
01404    return SS_SUCCESS;
01405 
01406 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01407 
01408 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01409 #ifndef NO_PTY
01410    pid_t pid;
01411    int i, pipe;
01412    char line[32], buffer[1024], shell[32];
01413    fd_set readfds;
01414 
01415    if ((pid = forkpty(&pipe, line, NULL, NULL)) < 0)
01416       return 0;
01417    else if (pid > 0) {
01418       /* parent process */
01419 
01420       do {
01421          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
01422          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
01423          FD_SET(pipe, &readfds);
01424 
01425          select(FD_SETSIZE, (void *) &readfds, NULL, NULL, NULL);
01426 
01427          if (FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
01428             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01429             i = recv(sock, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
01430             if (i <= 0)
01431                break;
01432             if (write(pipe, buffer, i) != i)
01433                break;
01434          }
01435 
01436          if (FD_ISSET(pipe, &readfds)) {
01437             memset(buffer, 0, sizeof(buffer));
01438             i = read(pipe, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
01439             if (i <= 0)
01440                break;
01441             send(sock, buffer, i, 0);
01442          }
01443 
01444       } while (1);
01445    } else {
01446       /* child process */
01447 
01448       if (getenv("SHELL"))
01449          strlcpy(shell, getenv("SHELL"), sizeof(shell));
01450       else
01451          strcpy(shell, "/bin/sh");
01452       execl(shell, shell, 0);
01453    }
01454 #else
01455    send(sock, "not implemented\n", 17, 0);
01456 #endif                          /* NO_PTY */
01457 
01458    return SS_SUCCESS;
01459 
01460 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01461 }
01462 
01463 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01464 static BOOL _daemon_flag;
01465 
01466 INT ss_daemon_init(BOOL keep_stdout)
01467 /********************************************************************\
01468 
01469   Routine: ss_daemon_init
01470 
01471   Purpose: Become a daemon
01472 
01473   Input:
01474     none
01475 
01476   Output:
01477     none
01478 
01479   Function value:
01480     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completeion
01481     SS_ABORT         fork() was not successful, or other problem
01482 
01483 \********************************************************************/
01484 {
01485 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01486 
01487    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01488    int i, fd, pid;
01489 
01490    if ((pid = fork()) < 0)
01491       return SS_ABORT;
01492    else if (pid != 0)
01493       exit(0);                  /* parent finished */
01494 
01495    /* child continues here */
01496 
01497    _daemon_flag = TRUE;
01498 
01499    /* try and use up stdin, stdout and stderr, so other
01500       routines writing to stdout etc won't cause havoc. Copied from smbd */
01501    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
01502       if (keep_stdout && ((i == 1) || (i == 2)))
01503          continue;
01504 
01505       close(i);
01506       fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
01507       if (fd < 0)
01508          fd = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY, 0);
01509       if (fd < 0) {
01510          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_system", "Can't open /dev/null");
01511          return SS_ABORT;
01512       }
01513       if (fd != i) {
01514          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_system", "Did not get file descriptor");
01515          return SS_ABORT;
01516       }
01517    }
01518 
01519    setsid();                    /* become session leader */
01520    chdir("/");                  /* change working direcotry (not on NFS!) */
01521    umask(0);                    /* clear our file mode createion mask */
01522 
01523 #endif
01524 
01525    return SS_SUCCESS;
01526 }
01527 
01528 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01529 BOOL ss_existpid(INT pid)
01530 /********************************************************************\
01531 
01532   Routine: ss_existpid
01533 
01534   Purpose: Execute a Kill sig=0 which return success if pid found.
01535 
01536   Input:
01537     pid  : pid to check
01538 
01539   Output:
01540     none
01541 
01542   Function value:
01543     TRUE      PID found
01544     FALSE     PID not found
01545 
01546 \********************************************************************/
01547 {
01548 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01549    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01550    return (kill(pid, 0) == 0 ? TRUE : FALSE);
01551 #else
01552    cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_existpid", "implemented for UNIX only");
01553    return FALSE;
01554 #endif
01555 }
01556 
01557 
01559 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01560 
01561 /********************************************************************/
01579 INT ss_system(char *command)
01580 {
01581 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01582    INT childpid;
01583 
01584    return ss_exec(command, &childpid);
01585 
01586 #else
01587 
01588    system(command);
01589    return SS_SUCCESS;
01590 
01591 #endif
01592 }
01593 
01595 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01596 
01597 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01598 INT ss_exec(char *command, INT * pid)
01599 /********************************************************************\
01600 
01601   Routine: ss_exec
01602 
01603   Purpose: Execute command in a separate process, close all open
01604            file descriptors, return the pid of the child process.
01605 
01606   Input:
01607     char * command    Command to execute
01608     INT  * pid        Returned PID of the spawned process.
01609   Output:
01610     none
01611 
01612   Function value:
01613     SS_SUCCESS       Successful completion
01614     SS_ABORT         fork() was not successful, or other problem
01615 
01616 \********************************************************************/
01617 {
01618 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01619 
01620    /* only implemented for UNIX */
01621    int i, fd;
01622 
01623    if ((*pid = fork()) < 0)
01624       return SS_ABORT;
01625    else if (*pid != 0) {
01626       /* avoid <defunc> parent processes */
01627       signal(SIGCHLD, catch_sigchld);
01628       return SS_SUCCESS;        /* parent returns */
01629    }
01630 
01631    /* child continues here... */
01632 
01633    /* close all open file descriptors */
01634    for (i = 0; i < 256; i++)
01635       close(i);
01636 
01637    /* try and use up stdin, stdout and stderr, so other
01638       routines writing to stdout etc won't cause havoc */
01639    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
01640       fd = open("/dev/null", O_RDWR, 0);
01641       if (fd < 0)
01642          fd = open("/dev/null", O_WRONLY, 0);
01643       if (fd < 0) {
01644          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Can't open /dev/null");
01645          return SS_ABORT;
01646       }
01647       if (fd != i) {
01648          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_exec", "Did not get file descriptor");
01649          return SS_ABORT;
01650       }
01651    }
01652 
01653    setsid();                    /* become session leader */
01654    /* chdir("/"); *//* change working directory (not on NFS!) */
01655    umask(0);                    /* clear our file mode createion mask */
01656 
01657    /* execute command */
01658    execl("/bin/sh", "sh", "-c", command, NULL);
01659 
01660 #else
01661 
01662    system(command);
01663 
01664 #endif
01665 
01666    return SS_SUCCESS;
01667 }
01668 
01670 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
01671 
01672 /********************************************************************/
01705 midas_thread_t ss_thread_create(INT(*thread_func) (void *), void *param)
01706 {
01707 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
01708 
01709    HANDLE status;
01710    DWORD thread_id;
01711 
01712    if (thread_func == NULL) {
01713       return 0;
01714    }
01715 
01716    status = CreateThread(NULL, 0, (LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE) thread_func,
01717                          (LPVOID) param, 0, &thread_id);
01718 
01719    return status == NULL ?  0 : (midas_thread_t)thread_id;
01720 
01721 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
01722 
01723    return 0;
01724 
01725 #elif defined(OS_VMS)
01726 
01727    return 0;
01728 
01729 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
01730 
01731 /* taskSpawn which could be considered as a thread under VxWorks
01732    requires several argument beside the thread args
01733    taskSpawn (taskname, priority, option, stacksize, entry_point
01734               , arg1, arg2, ... , arg9, arg10)
01735    all the arg will have to be retrieved from the param list.
01736    through a structure to be simpler  */
01737 
01738    INT status;
01739    VX_TASK_SPAWN *ts;
01740 
01741    ts = (VX_TASK_SPAWN *) param;
01742    status =
01743        taskSpawn(ts->name, ts->priority, ts->options, ts->stackSize,
01744                  (FUNCPTR) thread_func, ts->arg1, ts->arg2, ts->arg3,
01745                  ts->arg4, ts->arg5, ts->arg6, ts->arg7, ts->arg8, ts->arg9, ts->arg10);
01746 
01747    return status == ERROR ? 0 : status;
01748 
01749 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
01750 
01751    INT status;
01752    pthread_t thread_id;
01753 
01754    status = pthread_create(&thread_id, NULL, (void *) thread_func, param);
01755 
01756    return status != 0 ? 0 : thread_id;
01757 
01758 #endif
01759 }
01760 
01761 /********************************************************************/
01779 INT ss_thread_kill(midas_thread_t thread_id)
01780 {
01781 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
01782 
01783    DWORD status;
01784 
01785    status = TerminateThread(thread_id, 0);
01786 
01787    return status != 0 ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_NO_THREAD;
01788 
01789 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
01790 
01791    return 0;
01792 
01793 #elif defined(OS_VMS)
01794 
01795    return 0;
01796 
01797 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
01798 
01799    INT status;
01800    status = taskDelete(thread_id);
01801    return status == OK ? 0 : ERROR;
01802 
01803 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
01804 
01805    INT status;
01806    status = pthread_kill(thread_id, SIGKILL);
01807    return status == 0 ? SS_SUCCESS : SS_NO_THREAD;
01808 
01809 #endif
01810 }
01811 
01813 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
01814 
01815 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01816 static INT skip_mutex_handle = -1;
01817 
01818 INT ss_mutex_create(char *name, HNDLE * mutex_handle)
01819 /********************************************************************\
01820 
01821   Routine: ss_mutex_create
01822 
01823   Purpose: Create a mutex with a specific name
01824 
01825     Remark: Under VxWorks the specific semaphore handling is
01826             different than other OS. But VxWorks provides
01827             the POSIX-compatible semaphore interface.
01828             Under POSIX, no timeout is supported.
01829             So for the time being, we keep the pure VxWorks
01830             The semaphore type is a Binary instead of mutex
01831             as the binary is an optimized mutex.
01832 
01833   Input:
01834     char   *name            Name of the mutex to create
01835 
01836   Output:
01837     HNDLE  *mutex_handle    Handle of the created mutex
01838 
01839   Function value:
01840     SS_CREATED              Mutex was created
01841     SS_SUCCESS              Mutex existed already and was attached
01842     SS_NO_MUTEX             Cannot create mutex
01843 
01844 \********************************************************************/
01845 {
01846    char mutex_name[256], path[256], file_name[256];
01847 
01848    /* Add a leading SM_ to the mutex name */
01849    sprintf(mutex_name, "MX_%s", name);
01850 
01851 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
01852 
01853    /* semBCreate is a Binary semaphore which is under VxWorks a optimized mutex
01854       refering to the programmer's Guide 5.3.1 */
01855    if ((*((SEM_ID *) mutex_handle) = semBCreate(SEM_Q_FIFO, SEM_EMPTY)) == NULL)
01856       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01857    return SS_CREATED;
01858 
01859 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
01860 
01861    /* Build the filename out of the path and the name of the mutex */
01862    cm_get_path(path);
01863    if (path[0] == 0) {
01864       getcwd(path, 256);
01865 #if defined(OS_VMS)
01866 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
01867       strcat(path, "/");
01868 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
01869       strcat(path, "\\");
01870 #endif
01871    }
01872 
01873    strcpy(file_name, path);
01874 #if defined (OS_UNIX)
01875    strcat(file_name, ".");      /* dot file under UNIX */
01876 #endif
01877    strcat(file_name, name);
01878    strcat(file_name, ".SHM");
01879 
01880 #ifdef OS_WINNT
01881 
01882    *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) CreateMutex(NULL, FALSE, mutex_name);
01883 
01884    if (*mutex_handle == 0)
01885       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01886 
01887    return SS_CREATED;
01888 
01889 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
01890 #ifdef OS_VMS
01891 
01892    /* VMS has to use lock manager... */
01893 
01894    {
01895       INT status;
01896       $DESCRIPTOR(mutexname_dsc, "dummy");
01897       mutexname_dsc.dsc$w_length = strlen(mutex_name);
01898       mutexname_dsc.dsc$a_pointer = mutex_name;
01899 
01900       *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) malloc(8);
01901 
01902       status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_NLMODE, *mutex_handle, 0, &mutexname_dsc,
01903                         0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
01904 
01905       if (status != SS$_NORMAL) {
01906          free((void *) *mutex_handle);
01907          *mutex_handle = 0;
01908       }
01909 
01910       if (*mutex_handle == 0)
01911          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01912 
01913       return SS_CREATED;
01914    }
01915 
01916 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
01917 #ifdef OS_UNIX
01918 
01919    {
01920       INT key, status, fh;
01921       struct semid_ds buf;
01922 
01923 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
01924       union semun arg;
01925 #else
01926       union semun {
01927          INT val;
01928          struct semid_ds *buf;
01929          ushort *array;
01930       } arg;
01931 #endif
01932 
01933       status = SS_SUCCESS;
01934 
01935       /* create a unique key from the file name */
01936       key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
01937       if (key < 0) {
01938          fh = open(file_name, O_CREAT, 0644);
01939          close(fh);
01940          key = ftok(file_name, 'M');
01941          status = SS_CREATED;
01942       }
01943 
01944       /* create or get semaphore */
01945       *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, 0);
01946       if (*mutex_handle < 0) {
01947          *mutex_handle = (HNDLE) semget(key, 1, IPC_CREAT);
01948          status = SS_CREATED;
01949       }
01950 
01951       if (*mutex_handle < 0) {
01952          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_mutex_mutex", "semget() failed, errno = %d", errno);
01953          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01954       }
01955 
01956       buf.sem_perm.uid = getuid();
01957       buf.sem_perm.gid = getgid();
01958       buf.sem_perm.mode = 0666;
01959       arg.buf = &buf;
01960 
01961       semctl(*mutex_handle, 0, IPC_SET, arg);
01962 
01963       /* if semaphore was created, set value to one */
01964       if (status == SS_CREATED) {
01965          arg.val = 1;
01966          if (semctl(*mutex_handle, 0, SETVAL, arg) < 0)
01967             return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01968       }
01969 
01970       return SS_SUCCESS;
01971    }
01972 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
01973 
01974 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
01975    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
01976 #endif
01977 }
01978 
01979 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01980 INT ss_mutex_wait_for(HNDLE mutex_handle, INT timeout)
01981 /********************************************************************\
01982 
01983   Routine: ss_mutex_wait_for
01984 
01985   Purpose: Wait for a mutex to get owned
01986 
01987   Input:
01988     HNDLE  *mutex_handle    Handle of the created mutex
01989     INT    timeout          Timeout in ms, zero for no timeout
01990 
01991   Output:
01992     none
01993 
01994   Function value:
01995     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
01996     SS_NO_MUTEX             Invalid mutex handle
01997     SS_TIMEOUT              Timeout
01998 
01999 \********************************************************************/
02000 {
02001    INT status;
02002 
02003 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02004 
02005    status = WaitForSingleObject((HANDLE) mutex_handle, timeout == 0 ? INFINITE : timeout);
02006    if (status == WAIT_FAILED)
02007       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02008    if (status == WAIT_TIMEOUT)
02009       return SS_TIMEOUT;
02010 
02011    return SS_SUCCESS;
02012 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02013 #ifdef OS_VMS
02014    status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_EXMODE, mutex_handle, LCK$M_CONVERT, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
02015    if (status != SS$_NORMAL)
02016       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02017    return SS_SUCCESS;
02018 
02019 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02020 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02021    /* convert timeout in ticks (1/60) = 1000/60 ~ 1/16 = >>4 */
02022    status = semTake((SEM_ID) mutex_handle, timeout == 0 ? WAIT_FOREVER : timeout >> 4);
02023    if (status == ERROR)
02024       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02025    return SS_SUCCESS;
02026 
02027 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02028 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02029    {
02030       DWORD start_time;
02031       struct sembuf sb;
02032 
02033 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
02034       union semun arg;
02035 #else
02036       union semun {
02037          INT val;
02038          struct semid_ds *buf;
02039          ushort *array;
02040       } arg;
02041 #endif
02042 
02043       sb.sem_num = 0;
02044       sb.sem_op = -1;           /* decrement semaphore */
02045       sb.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
02046 
02047       memset(&arg, 0, sizeof(arg));
02048 
02049       /* don't request the mutex when in asynchronous state
02050          and mutex was locked already by foreground process */
02051       if (ss_in_async_routine_flag)
02052          if (semctl(mutex_handle, 0, GETPID, arg) == getpid())
02053             if (semctl(mutex_handle, 0, GETVAL, arg) == 0) {
02054                skip_mutex_handle = mutex_handle;
02055                return SS_SUCCESS;
02056             }
02057 
02058       skip_mutex_handle = -1;
02059 
02060       start_time = ss_millitime();
02061 
02062       do {
02063          status = semop(mutex_handle, &sb, 1);
02064 
02065          /* return on success */
02066          if (status == 0)
02067             break;
02068 
02069          /* retry if interrupted by a ss_wake signal */
02070          if (errno == EINTR) {
02071             /* return if timeout expired */
02072             if (timeout > 0 && ss_millitime() - start_time > timeout)
02073                return SS_TIMEOUT;
02074 
02075             continue;
02076          }
02077 
02078          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02079       } while (1);
02080 
02081       return SS_SUCCESS;
02082    }
02083 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02084 
02085 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02086    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02087 #endif
02088 }
02089 
02090 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02091 INT ss_mutex_release(HNDLE mutex_handle)
02092 /********************************************************************\
02093 
02094   Routine: ss_release_mutex
02095 
02096   Purpose: Release ownership of a mutex
02097 
02098   Input:
02099     HNDLE  *mutex_handle    Handle of the created mutex
02100 
02101   Output:
02102     none
02103 
02104   Function value:
02105     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02106     SS_NO_MUTEX             Invalid mutex handle
02107 
02108 \********************************************************************/
02109 {
02110    INT status;
02111 
02112 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02113 
02114    status = ReleaseMutex((HANDLE) mutex_handle);
02115 
02116    if (status == FALSE)
02117       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02118 
02119    return SS_SUCCESS;
02120 
02121 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02122 #ifdef OS_VMS
02123 
02124    status = sys$enqw(0, LCK$K_NLMODE, mutex_handle, LCK$M_CONVERT, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0);
02125 
02126    if (status != SS$_NORMAL)
02127       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02128 
02129    return SS_SUCCESS;
02130 
02131 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02132 
02133 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02134 
02135    if (semGive((SEM_ID) mutex_handle) == ERROR)
02136       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02137    return SS_SUCCESS;
02138 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02139 
02140 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02141    {
02142       struct sembuf sb;
02143 
02144       sb.sem_num = 0;
02145       sb.sem_op = 1;            /* increment semaphore */
02146       sb.sem_flg = SEM_UNDO;
02147 
02148       if (mutex_handle == skip_mutex_handle) {
02149          skip_mutex_handle = -1;
02150          return SS_SUCCESS;
02151       }
02152 
02153       do {
02154          status = semop(mutex_handle, &sb, 1);
02155 
02156          /* return on success */
02157          if (status == 0)
02158             break;
02159 
02160          /* retry if interrupted by a ss_wake signal */
02161          if (errno == EINTR)
02162             continue;
02163 
02164          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02165       } while (1);
02166 
02167       return SS_SUCCESS;
02168    }
02169 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02170 
02171 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02172    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02173 #endif
02174 }
02175 
02176 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02177 INT ss_mutex_delete(HNDLE mutex_handle, INT destroy_flag)
02178 /********************************************************************\
02179 
02180   Routine: ss_mutex_delete
02181 
02182   Purpose: Delete a mutex
02183 
02184   Input:
02185     HNDLE  *mutex_handle    Handle of the created mutex
02186 
02187   Output:
02188     none
02189 
02190   Function value:
02191     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02192     SS_NO_MUTEX             Invalid mutex handle
02193 
02194 \********************************************************************/
02195 {
02196 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02197 
02198    if (CloseHandle((HANDLE) mutex_handle) == FALSE)
02199       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02200 
02201    return SS_SUCCESS;
02202 
02203 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02204 #ifdef OS_VMS
02205 
02206    free((void *) mutex_handle);
02207    return SS_SUCCESS;
02208 
02209 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02210 
02211 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02212    /* no code for VxWorks destroy yet */
02213    if (semDelete((SEM_ID) mutex_handle) == ERROR)
02214       return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02215    return SS_SUCCESS;
02216 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02217 
02218 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02219 #if (defined(OS_LINUX) && !defined(_SEM_SEMUN_UNDEFINED)) || defined(OS_FREEBSD)
02220    union semun arg;
02221 #else
02222    union semun {
02223       INT val;
02224       struct semid_ds *buf;
02225       ushort *array;
02226    } arg;
02227 #endif
02228 
02229    memset(&arg, 0, sizeof(arg));
02230 
02231    if (destroy_flag)
02232       if (semctl(mutex_handle, 0, IPC_RMID, arg) < 0)
02233          return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02234 
02235    return SS_SUCCESS;
02236 
02237 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02238 
02239 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02240    return SS_NO_MUTEX;
02241 #endif
02242 }
02243 
02245 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02246 
02247 /********************************************************************/
02265 DWORD ss_millitime()
02266 {
02267 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02268 
02269    return (int) GetTickCount();
02270 
02271 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02272 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02273 
02274    return clock() * 55;
02275 
02276 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
02277 #ifdef OS_VMS
02278 
02279    {
02280       char time[8];
02281       DWORD lo, hi;
02282 
02283       sys$gettim(time);
02284 
02285       lo = *((DWORD *) time);
02286       hi = *((DWORD *) (time + 4));
02287 
02288 /*  return *lo / 10000; */
02289 
02290       return lo / 10000 + hi * 429496.7296;
02291 
02292    }
02293 
02294 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02295 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02296    {
02297       struct timeval tv;
02298 
02299       gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
02300 
02301       return tv.tv_sec * 1000 + tv.tv_usec / 1000;
02302    }
02303 
02304 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02305 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02306    {
02307       int count;
02308       static int ticks_per_msec = 0;
02309 
02310       if (ticks_per_msec == 0)
02311          ticks_per_msec = 1000 / sysClkRateGet();
02312 
02313       return tickGet() * ticks_per_msec;
02314    }
02315 #endif                          /* OS_VXWORKS */
02316 }
02317 
02318 /********************************************************************/
02332 DWORD ss_time()
02333 {
02334 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02335 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
02336    tzset();
02337 #endif
02338 #endif
02339    return (DWORD) time(NULL);
02340 }

02345 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02346 DWORD ss_settime(DWORD seconds)
02347 /********************************************************************\
02348 
02349   Routine: ss_settime
02350 
02351   Purpose: Set local time. Used to synchronize different computers
02352 
02353    Input:
02354     INT    Time in seconds since 1.1.1970 UTC.
02355 
02356   Output:
02357     none
02358 
02359   Function value:
02360 
02361 \********************************************************************/
02362 {
02363 #if defined(OS_WINNT)
02364    SYSTEMTIME st;
02365    struct tm *ltm;
02366 
02367    tzset();
02368    ltm = localtime((time_t *) & seconds);
02369 
02370    st.wYear = ltm->tm_year + 1900;
02371    st.wMonth = ltm->tm_mon + 1;
02372    st.wDay = ltm->tm_mday;
02373    st.wHour = ltm->tm_hour;
02374    st.wMinute = ltm->tm_min;
02375    st.wSecond = ltm->tm_sec;
02376    st.wMilliseconds = 0;
02377 
02378    SetLocalTime(&st);
02379 
02380 #elif defined(OS_DARWIN)
02381 
02382    assert(!"ss_settime() is not supported");
02383    /* not reached */
02384    return SS_NO_DRIVER;
02385 
02386 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
02387 
02388    stime((time_t *) & seconds);
02389 
02390 #elif defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02391 
02392    struct timespec ltm;
02393 
02394    ltm.tv_sec = seconds;
02395    ltm.tv_nsec = 0;
02396    clock_settime(CLOCK_REALTIME, &ltm);
02397 
02398 #endif
02399    return SS_SUCCESS;
02400 }

02402 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02403 char *ss_asctime()
02404 /********************************************************************\
02405 
02406   Routine: ss_asctime
02407 
02408   Purpose: Returns the local actual time as a string
02409 
02410   Input:
02411     none
02412 
02413   Output:
02414     none
02415 
02416   Function value:
02417     char   *     Time string
02418 
02419 \********************************************************************/
02420 {
02421    static char str[32];
02422    time_t seconds;
02423 
02424    seconds = (time_t) ss_time();
02425 
02426 #if !defined(OS_VXWORKS)
02427 #if !defined(OS_VMS)
02428    tzset();
02429 #endif
02430 #endif
02431    strcpy(str, asctime(localtime(&seconds)));
02432 
02433    /* strip new line */
02434    str[24] = 0;
02435 
02436    return str;
02437 }

02446            time and local time.

02463 #endif
02464 }

02467 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02468 
02469 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02470 /* dummy function for signal() call */
02471 void ss_cont()
02472 {
02473 }
02474 #endif
02475 
02477 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
02478 
02479 /********************************************************************/
02491 INT ss_sleep(INT millisec)
02492 {
02493    fd_set readfds;
02494    struct timeval timeout;
02495    int status;
02496    static int sock = 0;
02497 
02498    if (millisec == 0) {
02499 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02500       SuspendThread(GetCurrentThread());
02501 #endif
02502 #ifdef OS_VMS
02503       sys$hiber();
02504 #endif
02505 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02506       signal(SIGCONT, ss_cont);
02507       pause();
02508 #endif
02509       return SS_SUCCESS;
02510    }
02511 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02512    {
02513       WSADATA WSAData;
02514 
02515       /* Start windows sockets */
02516       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02517          return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
02518    }
02519 #endif
02520 
02521    timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
02522    timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
02523 
02524    if (!sock)
02525       sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
02526 
02527    FD_ZERO(&readfds);
02528    FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
02529    do {
02530       status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
02531 
02532       /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
02533       if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
02534          timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
02535 
02536    } while (status == -1);      /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
02537 
02538    return SS_SUCCESS;
02539 }
02540 
02542 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
02543 
02544 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02545 BOOL ss_kbhit()
02546 /********************************************************************\
02547 
02548   Routine: ss_kbhit
02549 
02550   Purpose: Returns TRUE if a key is pressed
02551 
02552   Input:
02553     none
02554 
02555   Output:
02556     none
02557 
02558   Function value:
02559     FALSE                 No key has been pressed
02560     TRUE                  Key has been pressed
02561 
02562 \********************************************************************/
02563 {
02564 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
02565 
02566    return kbhit();
02567 
02568 #endif                          /* OS_MSDOS */
02569 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02570 
02571    return kbhit();
02572 
02573 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02574 #ifdef OS_VMS
02575 
02576    return FALSE;
02577 
02578 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02579 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02580 
02581    int n;
02582 
02583    if (_daemon_flag)
02584       return 0;
02585 
02586    ioctl(0, FIONREAD, &n);
02587    return (n > 0);
02588 
02589 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02590 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
02591 
02592    int n;
02593    ioctl(0, FIONREAD, (long) &n);
02594    return (n > 0);
02595 
02596 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02597 }

02599 
02600 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02601 #ifdef LOCAL_ROUTINES
02602 
02603 INT ss_wake(INT pid, INT tid, INT thandle)
02604 /********************************************************************\
02605 
02606   Routine: ss_wake
02607 
02608   Purpose: Wake a process with a specific ID and optional with a
02609      specific thread ID (on OS with support threads).
02610 
02611   Input:
02612     INT    pid              Process ID
02613     INT    tid              Thread ID
02614     INT    thandle          Thread handle (used under Windows NT)
02615 
02616 
02617   Output:
02618     none
02619 
02620   Function value:
02621     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02622     SS_NO_PROCESS           Nonexisting process
02623 
02624 \********************************************************************/
02625 {
02626 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02627    HANDLE process_handle;
02628    HANDLE dup_thread_handle;
02629 
02630    /*
02631       Under Windows NT, it's a little bit tricky to get a thread handle
02632       which can be passed to other processes. First the calling process
02633       has to duplicate the GetCurrentThread() handle, then the process
02634       which gets this handle also has to use DuplicateHandle with the
02635       target process as its own. Then this duplicated handle can be used
02636       to the SupendThread() and ResumeThread() functions.
02637     */
02638 
02639    process_handle = OpenProcess(PROCESS_ALL_ACCESS, TRUE, pid);
02640 
02641    if (process_handle == 0)
02642       return SS_NO_PROCESS;
02643 
02644    DuplicateHandle(process_handle, (HANDLE) thandle, GetCurrentProcess(),
02645                    &dup_thread_handle, THREAD_ALL_ACCESS, TRUE, 0);
02646 
02647    /* close handles not to waste resources */
02648    CloseHandle(process_handle);
02649 
02650    if (dup_thread_handle == 0)
02651       return SS_NO_PROCESS;
02652 
02653    ResumeThread(dup_thread_handle);
02654 
02655    /* close handles not to waste resources */
02656    CloseHandle(dup_thread_handle);
02657 
02658    return SS_SUCCESS;
02659 
02660 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02661 #ifdef OS_VMS
02662 
02663    if (sys$wake(&pid, 0) == SS$_NONEXPR)
02664       return SS_NO_PROCESS;
02665 
02666    return SS_SUCCESS;
02667 
02668 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02669 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02670 
02671    if (kill(pid, SIGCONT) < 0)
02672       return SS_NO_PROCESS;
02673 
02674    return SS_SUCCESS;
02675 
02676    /*
02677       Bryan: kill has to get the target process out of pause(). Some
02678       UNIX documentation say that pause() terminates by receiving any
02679       signal which would be ok because the buffer manager is designed
02680       in a way where an additional wake doesn't hurt. If this is not
02681       true, one has to setup a signal(SIGCONT, dummy) in the ss_sleep
02682       routine or so. Please check this.
02683     */
02684 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02685 }
02686 
02687 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02688 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02689 
02690 static void (*UserCallback) (int);
02691 static UINT _timer_id = 0;
02692 
02693 VOID CALLBACK _timeCallback(UINT idEvent, UINT uReserved, DWORD dwUser,
02694                             DWORD dwReserved1, DWORD dwReserved2)
02695 {
02696    _timer_id = 0;
02697    if (UserCallback != NULL)
02698       UserCallback(0);
02699 }
02700 
02701 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02702 
02703 INT ss_alarm(INT millitime, void (*func) (int))
02704 /********************************************************************\
02705 
02706   Routine: ss_alarm
02707 
02708   Purpose: Schedules an alarm. Call function referenced by *func
02709      after the specified seconds.
02710 
02711   Input:
02712     INT    millitime        Time in milliseconds
02713     void   (*func)()        Function to be called after the spe-
02714           cified time.
02715 
02716   Output:
02717     none
02718 
02719   Function value:
02720     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02721 
02722 \********************************************************************/
02723 {
02724 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02725 
02726    UserCallback = func;
02727    if (millitime > 0)
02728       _timer_id =
02729           timeSetEvent(millitime, 100, (LPTIMECALLBACK) _timeCallback, 0, TIME_ONESHOT);
02730    else {
02731       if (_timer_id)
02732          timeKillEvent(_timer_id);
02733       _timer_id = 0;
02734    }
02735 
02736    return SS_SUCCESS;
02737 
02738 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02739 #ifdef OS_VMS
02740 
02741    signal(SIGALRM, func);
02742    alarm(millitime / 1000);
02743    return SS_SUCCESS;
02744 
02745 #endif                          /* OS_VMS */
02746 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02747 
02748    signal(SIGALRM, func);
02749    alarm(millitime / 1000);
02750    return SS_SUCCESS;
02751 
02752 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02753 }

02760 LONG MidasExceptionFilter(LPEXCEPTION_POINTERS pexcep)
02761 {
02762    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
02763       MidasExceptionHandler();
02764 
02765    return EXCEPTION_CONTINUE_SEARCH;
02766 }
02767 
02768 INT MidasExceptionSignal(INT sig)
02769 {
02770    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
02771       MidasExceptionHandler();
02772 
02773    raise(sig);
02774 
02775    return 0;
02776 }

02780 {

02782     MidasExceptionHandler();

02785 }
02786 */
02787 
02788 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */

02793 {

02795       MidasExceptionHandler();
02796 
02797    return (SS$_RESIGNAL);
02798 }

02801 {
02802    if (MidasExceptionHandler != NULL)
02803       MidasExceptionHandler();
