02810 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02811 INT ss_exception_handler(void (*func) ())
02812 /********************************************************************\
02813 
02814   Routine: ss_exception_handler
02815 
02816   Purpose: Establish new exception handler which is called before
02817      the program is aborted due to a Ctrl-Break or an access
02818      violation. This handler may clean up things which may
02819      otherwise left in an undefined state.
02820 
02821   Input:
02822     void  (*func)()     Address of handler function
02823   Output:
02824     none
02825 
02826   Function value:
02827     BM_SUCCESS          Successful completion
02828 
02829 \********************************************************************/
02830 {
02831 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02832 
02833    MidasExceptionHandler = func;
02834 /*  SetUnhandledExceptionFilter(
02835     (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER) MidasExceptionFilter);
02836 
02837   signal(SIGINT, MidasExceptionSignal);
02838   signal(SIGILL, MidasExceptionSignal);
02839   signal(SIGFPE, MidasExceptionSignal);
02840   signal(SIGSEGV, MidasExceptionSignal);
02841   signal(SIGTERM, MidasExceptionSignal);
02842   signal(SIGBREAK, MidasExceptionSignal);
02843   signal(SIGABRT, MidasExceptionSignal); */
02844 
02845 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02846 #ifdef OS_VMS
02847 
02848    MidasExceptionHandler = func;
02849    lib$establish(MidasExceptionFilter);
02850 
02851    signal(SIGINT, MidasExceptionSignal);
02852    signal(SIGILL, MidasExceptionSignal);
02853    signal(SIGQUIT, MidasExceptionSignal);
02854    signal(SIGFPE, MidasExceptionSignal);
02855    signal(SIGSEGV, MidasExceptionSignal);
02856    signal(SIGTERM, MidasExceptionSignal);
02857 
02858 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02859 
02860    return SS_SUCCESS;
02861 }
02862 
02863 #endif                          /* LOCAL_ROUTINES */
02864 
02865 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02866 void *ss_ctrlc_handler(void (*func) (int))
02867 /********************************************************************\
02868 
02869   Routine: ss_ctrlc_handler
02870 
02871   Purpose: Establish new exception handler which is called before
02872      the program is aborted due to a Ctrl-Break. This handler may
02873      clean up things which may otherwise left in an undefined state.
02874 
02875   Input:
02876     void  (*func)(int)     Address of handler function, if NULL
02877                            install default handler
02878 
02879   Output:
02880     none
02881 
02882   Function value:
02883     same as signal()
02884 
02885 \********************************************************************/
02886 {
02887 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02888 
02889    if (func == NULL) {
02890       signal(SIGBREAK, SIG_DFL);
02891       return signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
02892    } else {
02893       signal(SIGBREAK, func);
02894       return signal(SIGINT, func);
02895    }
02896    return NULL;
02897 
02898 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02899 #ifdef OS_VMS
02900 
02901    return signal(SIGINT, func);
02902 
02903 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
02904 
02905 #ifdef OS_UNIX
02906 
02907    if (func == NULL) {
02908       signal(SIGTERM, SIG_DFL);
02909       return (void *) signal(SIGINT, SIG_DFL);
02910    } else {
02911       signal(SIGTERM, func);
02912       return (void *) signal(SIGINT, func);
02913    }
02914 
02915 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
02916 }
02917 
02918 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02919 /********************************************************************\
02920 *                                                                    *
02921 *                  Suspend/resume functions                          *
02922 *                                                                    *
02923 \********************************************************************/
02924 
02925 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02926 /* globals */
02927 
02928 /*
02929    The suspend structure is used in a multithread environment
02930    (multi thread server) where each thread may resume another thread.
02931    Since all threads share the same global memory, the ports and
02932    sockets for suspending and resuming must be stored in a array
02933    which keeps one entry for each thread.
02934 */
02935 
02936 typedef struct {
02937    BOOL in_use;
02938    INT thread_id;
02939    INT ipc_port;
02940    INT ipc_recv_socket;
02941    INT ipc_send_socket;
02942     INT(*ipc_dispatch) (char *, INT);
02943    INT listen_socket;
02944     INT(*listen_dispatch) (INT);
02945    RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION *server_connection;
02946     INT(*client_dispatch) (INT);
02947    RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION *server_acception;
02948     INT(*server_dispatch) (INT, int, BOOL);
02949    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
02950 } SUSPEND_STRUCT;
02951 
02952 SUSPEND_STRUCT *_suspend_struct = NULL;
02953 INT _suspend_entries;
02954 
02955 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02956 INT ss_suspend_init_ipc(INT index)
02957 /********************************************************************\
02958 
02959   Routine: ss_suspend_init_ipc
02960 
02961   Purpose: Create sockets used in the suspend/resume mechanism.
02962 
02963   Input:
02964     INT    index            Index to the _suspend_struct array for
02965           the calling thread.
02966   Output:
02967     <indirect>              Set entry in _suspend_struct
02968 
02969   Function value:
02970     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
02971     SS_SOCKET_ERROR         Error in socket routines
02972     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
02973 
02974 \********************************************************************/
02975 {
02976    INT status, sock;
02977    int i;
02978    struct sockaddr_in bind_addr;
02979    char local_host_name[HOST_NAME_LENGTH];
02980    struct hostent *phe;
02981 
02982 #ifdef OS_WINNT
02983    {
02984       WSADATA WSAData;
02985 
02986       /* Start windows sockets */
02987       if (WSAStartup(MAKEWORD(1, 1), &WSAData) != 0)
02988          return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
02989    }
02990 #endif
02991 
02992   /*--------------- create UDP receive socket -------------------*/
02993    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
02994    if (sock == -1)
02995       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
02996 
02997    /* let OS choose port for socket */
02998    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
02999    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03000    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
03001    bind_addr.sin_port = 0;
03002 
03003    gethostname(local_host_name, sizeof(local_host_name));
03004 
03005 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
03006    {
03007       INT host_addr;
03008 
03009       host_addr = hostGetByName(local_host_name);
03010       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
03011    }
03012 #else
03013    phe = gethostbyname(local_host_name);
03014    if (phe == NULL) {
03015       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_suspend_init_ipc", "cannot get host name");
03016       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03017    }
03018    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
03019 #endif
03020 
03021    status = bind(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
03022    if (status < 0)
03023       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03024 
03025    /* find out which port OS has chosen */
03026    i = sizeof(bind_addr);
03027    getsockname(sock, (struct sockaddr *) &bind_addr, (int *) &i);
03028 
03029    _suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket = sock;
03030    _suspend_struct[index].ipc_port = ntohs(bind_addr.sin_port);
03031 
03032   /*--------------- create UDP send socket ----------------------*/
03033    sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
03034 
03035    if (sock == -1)
03036       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03037 
03038    /* fill out bind struct pointing to local host */
03039    memset(&bind_addr, 0, sizeof(bind_addr));
03040    bind_addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03041    bind_addr.sin_addr.s_addr = 0;
03042 
03043 #ifdef OS_VXWORKS
03044    {
03045       INT host_addr;
03046 
03047       host_addr = hostGetByName(local_host_name);
03048       memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), &host_addr, 4);
03049    }
03050 #else
03051    memcpy((char *) &(bind_addr.sin_addr), phe->h_addr, phe->h_length);
03052 #endif
03053 
03054    memcpy(&_suspend_struct[index].bind_addr, &bind_addr, sizeof(bind_addr));
03055    _suspend_struct[index].ipc_send_socket = sock;
03056 
03057    return SS_SUCCESS;
03058 }
03059 
03060 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03061 INT ss_suspend_get_index(INT * pindex)
03062 /********************************************************************\
03063 
03064   Routine: ss_suspend_init
03065 
03066   Purpose: Return the index for the suspend structure for this
03067      thread.
03068 
03069   Input:
03070     none
03071 
03072   Output:
03073     INT    *pindex          Index to the _suspend_struct array for
03074           the calling thread.
03075 
03076   Function value:
03077     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03078     SS_NO_MEMORY            Not enough memory
03079 
03080 \********************************************************************/
03081 {
03082    INT index;
03083 
03084    if (_suspend_struct == NULL) {
03085       /* create a new entry for this thread */
03086       _suspend_struct = (SUSPEND_STRUCT *) malloc(sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03087       memset(_suspend_struct, 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03088       if (_suspend_struct == NULL)
03089          return SS_NO_MEMORY;
03090 
03091       _suspend_entries = 1;
03092       *pindex = 0;
03093       _suspend_struct[0].thread_id = ss_gettid();
03094       _suspend_struct[0].in_use = TRUE;
03095    } else {
03096       /* check for an existing entry for this thread */
03097       for (index = 0; index < _suspend_entries; index++)
03098          if (_suspend_struct[index].thread_id == ss_gettid()) {
03099             if (pindex != NULL)
03100                *pindex = index;
03101 
03102             return SS_SUCCESS;
03103          }
03104 
03105       /* check for a deleted entry */
03106       for (index = 0; index < _suspend_entries; index++)
03107          if (!_suspend_struct[index].in_use)
03108             break;
03109 
03110       if (index == _suspend_entries) {
03111          /* if not found, create new one */
03112          _suspend_struct = (SUSPEND_STRUCT *) realloc(_suspend_struct,
03113                                                       sizeof
03114                                                       (SUSPEND_STRUCT) *
03115                                                       (_suspend_entries + 1));
03116          memset(&_suspend_struct[_suspend_entries], 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03117 
03118          _suspend_entries++;
03119          if (_suspend_struct == NULL) {
03120             _suspend_entries--;
03121             return SS_NO_MEMORY;
03122          }
03123       }
03124       *pindex = index;
03125       _suspend_struct[index].thread_id = ss_gettid();
03126       _suspend_struct[index].in_use = TRUE;
03127    }
03128 
03129    return SS_SUCCESS;
03130 }
03131 
03132 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03133 INT ss_suspend_exit()
03134 /********************************************************************\
03135 
03136   Routine: ss_suspend_exit
03137 
03138   Purpose: Closes the sockets used in the suspend/resume mechanism.
03139      Should be called before a thread exits.
03140 
03141   Input:
03142     none
03143 
03144   Output:
03145     none
03146 
03147   Function value:
03148     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03149 
03150 \********************************************************************/
03151 {
03152    INT i, status;
03153 
03154    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&i);
03155 
03156    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03157       return status;
03158 
03159    if (_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket) {
03160       closesocket(_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket);
03161       closesocket(_suspend_struct[i].ipc_send_socket);
03162    }
03163 
03164    memset(&_suspend_struct[i], 0, sizeof(SUSPEND_STRUCT));
03165 
03166    /* calculate new _suspend_entries value */
03167    for (i = _suspend_entries - 1; i >= 0; i--)
03168       if (_suspend_struct[i].in_use)
03169          break;
03170 
03171    _suspend_entries = i + 1;
03172 
03173    if (_suspend_entries == 0) {
03174       free(_suspend_struct);
03175       _suspend_struct = NULL;
03176    }
03177 
03178    return SS_SUCCESS;
03179 }
03180 
03181 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03182 INT ss_suspend_set_dispatch(INT channel, void *connection, INT(*dispatch) ())
03183 /********************************************************************\
03184 
03185   Routine: ss_suspend_set_dispatch
03186 
03187   Purpose: Set dispatch functions which get called whenever new data
03188      on various sockets arrive inside the ss_suspend function.
03189 
03190      Beside the Inter Process Communication socket several other
03191      sockets can simultanously watched: A "listen" socket for
03192      a server main thread, server sockets which receive new
03193      RPC requests from remote clients (given by the
03194      server_acception array) and client sockets which may
03195      get notification data from remote servers (such as
03196      database updates).
03197 
03198   Input:
03199     INT    channel               One of CH_IPC, CH_CLIENT,
03200          CH_SERVER, CH_MSERVER
03201 
03202     INT    (*dispatch())         Function being called
03203 
03204   Output:
03205     none
03206 
03207   Function value:
03208     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03209 
03210 \********************************************************************/
03211 {
03212    INT i, status;
03213 
03214    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&i);
03215 
03216    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03217       return status;
03218 
03219    if (channel == CH_IPC) {
03220       _suspend_struct[i].ipc_dispatch = (INT(*)(char *, INT)) dispatch;
03221 
03222       if (!_suspend_struct[i].ipc_recv_socket)
03223          ss_suspend_init_ipc(i);
03224    }
03225 
03226    if (channel == CH_LISTEN) {
03227       _suspend_struct[i].listen_socket = *((INT *) connection);
03228       _suspend_struct[i].listen_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT)) dispatch;
03229    }
03230 
03231    if (channel == CH_CLIENT) {
03232       _suspend_struct[i].server_connection = (RPC_SERVER_CONNECTION *) connection;
03233       _suspend_struct[i].client_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT)) dispatch;
03234    }
03235 
03236    if (channel == CH_SERVER) {
03237       _suspend_struct[i].server_acception = (RPC_SERVER_ACCEPTION *) connection;
03238       _suspend_struct[i].server_dispatch = (INT(*)(INT, int, BOOL)) dispatch;
03239    }
03240 
03241    return SS_SUCCESS;
03242 }
03243 
03244 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03245 INT ss_suspend_get_port(INT * port)
03246 /********************************************************************\
03247 
03248   Routine: ss_suspend_get_port
03249 
03250   Purpose: Return the UDP port number which can be used to resume
03251      the calling thread inside a ss_suspend function. The port
03252      number can then be used by another process as a para-
03253      meter to the ss_resume function to resume the thread
03254      which called ss_suspend.
03255 
03256   Input:
03257     none
03258 
03259   Output:
03260     INT    *port            UDP port number
03261 
03262   Function value:
03263     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03264 
03265 \********************************************************************/
03266 {
03267    INT index, status;
03268 
03269    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&index);
03270 
03271    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03272       return status;
03273 
03274    if (!_suspend_struct[index].ipc_port)
03275       ss_suspend_init_ipc(index);
03276 
03277    *port = _suspend_struct[index].ipc_port;
03278 
03279    return SS_SUCCESS;
03280 }
03281 
03282 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03283 INT ss_suspend(INT millisec, INT msg)
03284 /********************************************************************\
03285 
03286   Routine: ss_suspend
03287 
03288   Purpose: Suspend the calling thread for a speficic time. If
03289      timeout (in millisec.) is negative, the thead is suspended
03290      indefinitely. It can only be resumed from another thread
03291      or process which calls ss_resume or by some data which
03292      arrives on the client or server sockets.
03293 
03294      If msg equals to one of MSG_BM, MSG_ODB, the function
03295      return whenever such a message is received.
03296 
03297   Input:
03298     INT    millisec         Timeout in milliseconds
03299     INT    msg              Return from ss_suspend when msg
03300           (MSG_BM, MSG_ODB) is received.
03301 
03302   Output:
03303     none
03304 
03305   Function value:
03306     SS_SUCCESS              Requested message was received
03307     SS_TIMEOUT              Timeout expired
03308     SS_SERVER_RECV          Server channel got data
03309     SS_CLIENT_RECV          Client channel got data
03310     SS_ABORT (RPC_ABORT)    Connection lost
03311     SS_EXIT                 Connection closed
03312 
03313 \********************************************************************/
03314 {
03315    fd_set readfds;
03316    struct timeval timeout;
03317    INT sock, server_socket;
03318    INT index, status, i, return_status;
03319    int size;
03320    struct sockaddr from_addr;
03321    char str[100], buffer[80], buffer_tmp[80];
03322 
03323    /* get index to _suspend_struct for this thread */
03324    status = ss_suspend_get_index(&index);
03325 
03326    if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03327       return status;
03328 
03329    return_status = SS_TIMEOUT;
03330 
03331    do {
03332       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
03333 
03334       /* check listen socket */
03335       if (_suspend_struct[index].listen_socket)
03336          FD_SET(_suspend_struct[index].listen_socket, &readfds);
03337 
03338       /* check server channels */
03339       if (_suspend_struct[index].server_acception)
03340          for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
03341             /* RPC channel */
03342             sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].recv_sock;
03343 
03344             /* only watch the event tcp connection belonging to this thread */
03345             if (!sock || _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].tid != ss_gettid())
03346                continue;
03347 
03348             /* watch server socket if no data in cache */
03349             if (recv_tcp_check(sock) == 0)
03350                FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03351             /* set timeout to zero if data in cache (-> just quick check IPC)
03352                and not called from inside bm_send_event (-> wait for IPC) */
03353             else if (msg == 0)
03354                millisec = 0;
03355 
03356             /* event channel */
03357             sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].event_sock;
03358 
03359             if (!sock)
03360                continue;
03361 
03362             /* watch server socket if no data in cache */
03363             if (recv_event_check(sock) == 0)
03364                FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03365             /* set timeout to zero if data in cache (-> just quick check IPC)
03366                and not called from inside bm_send_event (-> wait for IPC) */
03367             else if (msg == 0)
03368                millisec = 0;
03369          }
03370 
03371       /* watch client recv connections */
03372       if (_suspend_struct[index].server_connection) {
03373          sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_connection->recv_sock;
03374          if (sock)
03375             FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03376       }
03377 
03378       /* check IPC socket */
03379       if (_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket)
03380          FD_SET(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds);
03381 
03382       timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
03383       timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
03384 
03385       do {
03386          if (millisec < 0)
03387             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, NULL);    /* blocking */
03388          else
03389             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
03390 
03391          /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
03392          if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
03393             timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
03394 
03395       } while (status == -1);   /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03396 
03397       /* if listen socket got data, call dispatcher with socket */
03398       if (_suspend_struct[index].listen_socket &&
03399           FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[index].listen_socket, &readfds)) {
03400          sock = _suspend_struct[index].listen_socket;
03401 
03402          if (_suspend_struct[index].listen_dispatch) {
03403             status = _suspend_struct[index].listen_dispatch(sock);
03404             if (status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03405                return status;
03406          }
03407       }
03408 
03409       /* check server channels */
03410       if (_suspend_struct[index].server_acception)
03411          for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
03412             /* rpc channel */
03413             sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].recv_sock;
03414 
03415             /* only watch the event tcp connection belonging to this thread */
03416             if (!sock || _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].tid != ss_gettid())
03417                continue;
03418 
03419             if (recv_tcp_check(sock) || FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03420                if (_suspend_struct[index].server_dispatch) {
03421                   status = _suspend_struct[index].server_dispatch(i, sock, msg != 0);
03422                   _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].
03423                       last_activity = ss_millitime();
03424 
03425                   if (status == SS_ABORT || status == SS_EXIT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03426                      return status;
03427 
03428                   return_status = SS_SERVER_RECV;
03429                }
03430             }
03431 
03432             /* event channel */
03433             sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].event_sock;
03434             if (!sock)
03435                continue;
03436 
03437             if (recv_event_check(sock) || FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03438                if (_suspend_struct[index].server_dispatch) {
03439                   status = _suspend_struct[index].server_dispatch(i, sock, msg != 0);
03440                   _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].
03441                       last_activity = ss_millitime();
03442 
03443                   if (status == SS_ABORT || status == SS_EXIT || status == RPC_SHUTDOWN)
03444                      return status;
03445 
03446                   return_status = SS_SERVER_RECV;
03447                }
03448             }
03449          }
03450 
03451       /* check server message channels */
03452       if (_suspend_struct[index].server_connection) {
03453          sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_connection->recv_sock;
03454 
03455          if (sock && FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds)) {
03456             if (_suspend_struct[index].client_dispatch)
03457                status = _suspend_struct[index].client_dispatch(sock);
03458             else {
03459                status = SS_SUCCESS;
03460                size = recv_tcp(sock, buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0);
03461 
03462                if (size <= 0)
03463                   status = SS_ABORT;
03464             }
03465 
03466             if (status == SS_ABORT) {
03467                sprintf(str, "Server connection broken to %s",
03468                        _suspend_struct[index].server_connection->host_name);
03469                cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_suspend", str);
03470 
03471                /* close client connection if link broken */
03472                closesocket(_suspend_struct[index].server_connection->send_sock);
03473                closesocket(_suspend_struct[index].server_connection->recv_sock);
03474                closesocket(_suspend_struct[index].server_connection->event_sock);
03475 
03476                memset(_suspend_struct[index].server_connection,
03477                       0, sizeof(RPC_CLIENT_CONNECTION));
03478 
03479                /* exit program after broken connection to MIDAS server */
03480                return SS_ABORT;
03481             }
03482 
03483             return_status = SS_CLIENT_RECV;
03484          }
03485       }
03486 
03487       /* check IPC socket */
03488       if (_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket &&
03489           FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds)) {
03490          /* receive IPC message */
03491          size = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
03492          size = recvfrom(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket,
03493                          buffer, sizeof(buffer), 0, &from_addr, (int *) &size);
03494 
03495          /* find out if this thread is connected as a server */
03496          server_socket = 0;
03497          if (_suspend_struct[index].server_acception &&
03498              rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_TYPE) != ST_REMOTE)
03499             for (i = 0; i < MAX_RPC_CONNECTION; i++) {
03500                sock = _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].send_sock;
03501                if (sock && _suspend_struct[index].server_acception[i].tid == ss_gettid())
03502                   server_socket = sock;
03503             }
03504 
03505          /* receive further messages to empty UDP queue */
03506          do {
03507             FD_ZERO(&readfds);
03508             FD_SET(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds);
03509 
03510             timeout.tv_sec = 0;
03511             timeout.tv_usec = 0;
03512 
03513             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
03514 
03515             if (status != -1
03516                 && FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds)) {
03517                size = sizeof(struct sockaddr);
03518                size =
03519                    recvfrom(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket,
03520                             buffer_tmp, sizeof(buffer_tmp), 0, &from_addr, &size);
03521 
03522                /* don't forward same MSG_BM as above */
03523                if (buffer_tmp[0] != 'B' || strcmp(buffer_tmp, buffer) != 0)
03524                   if (_suspend_struct[index].ipc_dispatch)
03525                      _suspend_struct[index].ipc_dispatch(buffer_tmp, server_socket);
03526             }
03527 
03528          } while (FD_ISSET(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_recv_socket, &readfds));
03529 
03530          /* return if received requested message */
03531          if (msg == MSG_BM && buffer[0] == 'B')
03532             return SS_SUCCESS;
03533          if (msg == MSG_ODB && buffer[0] == 'O')
03534             return SS_SUCCESS;
03535 
03536          /* call dispatcher */
03537          if (_suspend_struct[index].ipc_dispatch)
03538             _suspend_struct[index].ipc_dispatch(buffer, server_socket);
03539 
03540          return_status = SS_SUCCESS;
03541       }
03542 
03543    } while (millisec < 0);
03544 
03545    return return_status;
03546 }
03547 
03548 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03549 INT ss_resume(INT port, char *message)
03550 /********************************************************************\
03551 
03552   Routine: ss_resume
03553 
03554   Purpose: Resume another thread or process which called ss_suspend.
03555      The port has to be transfered (shared memory or so) from
03556      the thread or process which should be resumed. In that
03557      process it can be obtained via ss_suspend_get_port.
03558 
03559   Input:
03560     INT    port             UDP port number
03561     INT    msg              Mesage id & parameter transferred to
03562     INT    param              target process
03563 
03564   Output:
03565     none
03566 
03567   Function value:
03568     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
03569     SS_SOCKET_ERROR         Socket error
03570 
03571 \********************************************************************/
03572 {
03573    INT status, index;
03574 
03575    if (ss_in_async_routine_flag) {
03576       /* if called from watchdog, tid is different under NT! */
03577       index = 0;
03578    } else {
03579       status = ss_suspend_get_index(&index);
03580 
03581       if (status != SS_SUCCESS)
03582          return status;
03583    }
03584 
03585    _suspend_struct[index].bind_addr.sin_port = htons((short) port);
03586 
03587    status = sendto(_suspend_struct[index].ipc_send_socket, message,
03588                    strlen(message) + 1, 0,
03589                    (struct sockaddr *) &_suspend_struct[index].bind_addr,
03590                    sizeof(struct sockaddr_in));
03591 
03592    if (status != (INT) strlen(message) + 1)
03593       return SS_SOCKET_ERROR;
03594 
03595    return SS_SUCCESS;
03596 }
03597 
03598 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03599 /********************************************************************\
03600 *                                                                    *
03601 *                     Network functions                              *
03602 *                                                                    *
03603 \********************************************************************/
03604 
03605 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03606 INT send_tcp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
03607 /********************************************************************\
03608 
03609   Routine: send_tcp
03610 
03611   Purpose: Send network data over TCP port. Break buffer in smaller
03612            parts if larger than maximum TCP buffer size (usually 64k).
03613 
03614   Input:
03615     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03616     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03617     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
03618 
03619   Output:
03620     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03621 
03622   Function value:
03623     INT                     Same as send()
03624 
03625 \********************************************************************/
03626 {
03627    DWORD count;
03628    INT status;
03629 
03630    /* transfer fragments until complete buffer is transferred */
03631 
03632    for (count = 0; (INT) count < (INT) buffer_size - NET_TCP_SIZE;) {
03633       status = send(sock, buffer + count, NET_TCP_SIZE, flags);
03634       if (status != -1)
03635          count += status;
03636       else {
03637          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
03638                 "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03639                 sock, NET_TCP_SIZE, status, errno, strerror(errno));
03640          return status;
03641       }
03642    }
03643 
03644    while (count < buffer_size) {
03645       status = send(sock, buffer + count, buffer_size - count, flags);
03646       if (status != -1)
03647          count += status;
03648       else {
03649          cm_msg(MERROR, "send_tcp",
03650                 "send(socket=%d,size=%d) returned %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03651                 sock, (int) (buffer_size - count), status, errno, strerror(errno));
03652          return status;
03653       }
03654    }
03655 
03656    return count;
03657 }
03658 
03659 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03660 INT recv_string(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT millisec)
03661 /********************************************************************\
03662 
03663   Routine: recv_string
03664 
03665   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
03666      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
03667      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
03668      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
03669      one has to issue several recv() commands.
03670 
03671      The length of the data is determined by a trailing zero.
03672 
03673   Input:
03674     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03675     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03676     INT   millisec           Timeout in ms
03677 
03678   Output:
03679     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03680 
03681   Function value:
03682     INT                      String length
03683 
03684 \********************************************************************/
03685 {
03686    INT i, status;
03687    DWORD n;
03688    fd_set readfds;
03689    struct timeval timeout;
03690 
03691    n = 0;
03692    memset(buffer, 0, buffer_size);
03693 
03694    do {
03695       if (millisec > 0) {
03696          FD_ZERO(&readfds);
03697          FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
03698 
03699          timeout.tv_sec = millisec / 1000;
03700          timeout.tv_usec = (millisec % 1000) * 1000;
03701 
03702          do {
03703             status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
03704 
03705             /* if an alarm signal was cought, restart select with reduced timeout */
03706             if (status == -1 && timeout.tv_sec >= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000)
03707                timeout.tv_sec -= WATCHDOG_INTERVAL / 1000;
03708 
03709          } while (status == -1);        /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03710 
03711          if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
03712             break;
03713       }
03714 
03715       i = recv(sock, buffer + n, 1, 0);
03716 
03717       if (i <= 0)
03718          break;
03719 
03720       n++;
03721 
03722       if (n >= buffer_size)
03723          break;
03724 
03725    } while (buffer[n - 1] && buffer[n - 1] != 10);
03726 
03727    return n - 1;
03728 }
03729 
03730 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03731 INT recv_tcp(int sock, char *net_buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
03732 /********************************************************************\
03733 
03734   Routine: recv_tcp
03735 
03736   Purpose: Receive network data over TCP port. Since sockets are
03737      operated in stream mode, a single transmission via send
03738      may not transfer the full data. Therefore, one has to check
03739      at the receiver side if the full data is received. If not,
03740      one has to issue several recv() commands.
03741 
03742      The length of the data is determined by the data header,
03743      which consists of two DWORDs. The first is the command code
03744      (or function id), the second is the size of the following
03745      parameters in bytes. From that size recv_tcp() determines
03746      how much data to receive.
03747 
03748   Input:
03749     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03750     char  *net_buffer        Buffer to store data to
03751     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03752     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
03753 
03754   Output:
03755     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03756 
03757   Function value:
03758     INT                      Same as recv()
03759 
03760 \********************************************************************/
03761 {
03762    INT param_size, n_received, n;
03763    NET_COMMAND *nc;
03764 
03765    if (buffer_size < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER)) {
03766       cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp", "parameters too large for network buffer");
03767       return -1;
03768    }
03769 
03770    /* first receive header */
03771    n_received = 0;
03772    do {
03773 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03774       do {
03775          n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
03776 
03777          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
03778       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03779 #else
03780       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + n_received, sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER), flags);
03781 #endif
03782 
03783       if (n <= 0) {
03784          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
03785                 "header: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03786                 n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
03787          return n;
03788       }
03789 
03790       n_received += n;
03791 
03792    } while (n_received < sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER));
03793 
03794    /* now receive parameters */
03795 
03796    nc = (NET_COMMAND *) net_buffer;
03797    param_size = nc->header.param_size;
03798    n_received = 0;
03799 
03800    if (param_size == 0)
03801       return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER);
03802 
03803    do {
03804 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03805       do {
03806          n = recv(sock,
03807                   net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received,
03808                   param_size - n_received, flags);
03809 
03810          /* don't return if an alarm signal was cought */
03811       } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03812 #else
03813       n = recv(sock, net_buffer + sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + n_received,
03814                param_size - n_received, flags);
03815 #endif
03816 
03817       if (n <= 0) {
03818          cm_msg(MERROR, "recv_tcp",
03819                 "param: recv returned %d, n_received = %d, errno: %d (%s)",
03820                 n, n_received, errno, strerror(errno));
03821          return n;
03822       }
03823 
03824       n_received += n;
03825    } while (n_received < param_size);
03826 
03827    return sizeof(NET_COMMAND_HEADER) + param_size;
03828 }
03829 
03830 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03831 INT send_udp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
03832 /********************************************************************\
03833 
03834   Routine: send_udp
03835 
03836   Purpose: Send network data over UDP port. If buffer_size is small,
03837      collect several events and send them together. If
03838      buffer_size is larger than largest datagram size
03839      NET_UDP_SIZE, split event in several udp buffers and
03840      send them separately with serial number protection.
03841 
03842   Input:
03843     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03844     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03845     INT   flags              Flags passed to send()
03846 
03847   Output:
03848     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03849 
03850   Function value:
03851     INT                     Same as send()
03852 
03853 \********************************************************************/
03854 {
03855    INT status;
03856    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
03857    static char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
03858    static INT serial_number = 0, n_received = 0;
03859    DWORD i, data_size;
03860 
03861    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
03862    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03863 
03864    /*
03865       If buffer size is between half the UPD size and full UDP size,
03866       send immediately a single packet.
03867     */
03868    if (buffer_size >= NET_UDP_SIZE / 2 && buffer_size <= data_size) {
03869       /*
03870          If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first.
03871        */
03872       if (n_received) {
03873          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03874          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03875 
03876          send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03877          n_received = 0;
03878       }
03879 
03880       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
03881       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03882 
03883       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
03884       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, buffer_size + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03885       if (status == (INT) buffer_size + (int) sizeof(UDP_HEADER))
03886          status -= sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03887 
03888       return status;
03889    }
03890 
03891    /*
03892       If buffer size is smaller than half the UDP size, collect events
03893       until UDP buffer is optimal filled.
03894     */
03895    if (buffer_size <= data_size) {
03896       /* If udp_buffer has space, just copy it there */
03897       if (buffer_size + n_received < data_size) {
03898          memcpy(udp_buffer + sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + n_received, buffer, buffer_size);
03899 
03900          n_received += buffer_size;
03901          return buffer_size;
03902       }
03903 
03904       /* If udp_buffer has not enough space, send it */
03905       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03906       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03907 
03908       status = send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03909 
03910       n_received = 0;
03911 
03912       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer, buffer_size);
03913       n_received = buffer_size;
03914 
03915       return buffer_size;
03916    }
03917 
03918    /*
03919       If buffer size is larger than UDP size, split event in several
03920       buffers.
03921     */
03922 
03923    /* If there is any data already in the buffer, send it first */
03924    if (n_received) {
03925       udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | n_received;
03926       udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03927 
03928       send(sock, udp_buffer, n_received + sizeof(UDP_HEADER), flags);
03929       n_received = 0;
03930    }
03931 
03932    for (i = 0; i < ((buffer_size - 1) / data_size); i++) {
03933       if (i == 0) {
03934          udp_header->serial_number = UDP_FIRST | buffer_size;
03935          udp_header->sequence_number = ++serial_number;
03936       } else {
03937          udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
03938          udp_header->sequence_number = i;
03939       }
03940 
03941       memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, data_size);
03942       send(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
03943    }
03944 
03945    /* Send remaining bytes */
03946    udp_header->serial_number = serial_number;
03947    udp_header->sequence_number = i;
03948    memcpy(udp_header + 1, buffer + i * data_size, buffer_size - i * data_size);
03949    status =
03950        send(sock, udp_buffer, sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size, flags);
03951    if ((DWORD) status == sizeof(UDP_HEADER) + buffer_size - i * data_size)
03952       return buffer_size;
03953 
03954    return status;
03955 }
03956 
03957 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03958 INT recv_udp(int sock, char *buffer, DWORD buffer_size, INT flags)
03959 /********************************************************************\
03960 
03961   Routine: recv_udp
03962 
03963   Purpose: Receive network data over UDP port. If received event
03964      is splitted into several buffers, recombine them checking
03965      the serial number. If one buffer is missing in a splitted
03966      event, throw away the whole event.
03967 
03968   Input:
03969     INT   sock               Socket which was previosly opened.
03970     DWORD buffer_size        Size of the buffer in bytes.
03971     INT   flags              Flags passed to recv()
03972 
03973   Output:
03974     char  *buffer            Network receive buffer.
03975 
03976   Function value:
03977     INT                     Same as recv()
03978 
03979 \********************************************************************/
03980 {
03981    INT i, status;
03982    UDP_HEADER *udp_header;
03983    char udp_buffer[NET_UDP_SIZE];
03984    DWORD serial_number, sequence_number, total_buffer_size;
03985    DWORD data_size, n_received;
03986    fd_set readfds;
03987    struct timeval timeout;
03988 
03989    udp_header = (UDP_HEADER *) udp_buffer;
03990    data_size = NET_UDP_SIZE - sizeof(UDP_HEADER);
03991 
03992    /* Receive the first buffer */
03993 #ifdef OS_UNIX
03994    do {
03995       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
03996 
03997       /* dont return if an alarm signal was cought */
03998    } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
03999 #else
04000    i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04001 #endif
04002 
04003  start:
04004 
04005    /* Receive buffers until we get a sequence start */
04006    while (!(udp_header->serial_number & UDP_FIRST)) {
04007       /* wait for data with timeout */
04008       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04009       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04010 
04011       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04012       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04013 
04014       do {
04015          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04016       } while (status == -1);
04017 
04018       /*
04019          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04020          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04021        */
04022       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04023          return 0;
04024 
04025 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04026       do {
04027          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04028 
04029          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04030       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04031 #else
04032       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04033 #endif
04034    }
04035 
04036    /* if no others are following, return */
04037    total_buffer_size = udp_header->serial_number & ~UDP_FIRST;
04038    serial_number = udp_header->sequence_number;
04039    sequence_number = 0;
04040 
04041    if (total_buffer_size <= data_size) {
04042       if (buffer_size < total_buffer_size) {
04043          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04044          return buffer_size;
04045       } else {
04046          memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, total_buffer_size);
04047          return total_buffer_size;
04048       }
04049    }
04050 
04051    /* if others are following, collect them */
04052    n_received = data_size;
04053 
04054    if (buffer_size < data_size) {
04055       memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, buffer_size);
04056       return buffer_size;
04057    }
04058 
04059    memcpy(buffer, udp_header + 1, data_size);
04060 
04061 
04062    do {
04063       /* wait for new data with timeout */
04064       FD_ZERO(&readfds);
04065       FD_SET(sock, &readfds);
04066 
04067       timeout.tv_sec = 0;
04068       timeout.tv_usec = 100000; /* 0.1 s */
04069 
04070       do {
04071          status = select(FD_SETSIZE, &readfds, NULL, NULL, &timeout);
04072       } while (status == -1);
04073 
04074       /*
04075          If we got nothing, return zero so that calling program can do
04076          other things like checking TCP port for example.
04077        */
04078       if (!FD_ISSET(sock, &readfds))
04079          return 0;
04080 
04081 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04082       do {
04083          i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04084 
04085          /* dont return if an alarm signal was caught */
04086       } while (i == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04087 #else
04088       i = recv(sock, udp_buffer, NET_UDP_SIZE, flags);
04089 #endif
04090 
04091       sequence_number++;
04092 
04093       /* check sequence and serial numbers */
04094       if (udp_header->serial_number != serial_number ||
04095           udp_header->sequence_number != sequence_number)
04096          /* lost one, so start again */
04097          goto start;
04098 
04099       /* copy what we got */
04100       memcpy(buffer + n_received, udp_header + 1, i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04101 
04102       n_received += (i - sizeof(UDP_HEADER));
04103 
04104    } while (n_received < total_buffer_size);
04105 
04106    return n_received;
04107 }
04108 
04109 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04110 
04111 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
04112 #ifdef sopen
04113 /********************************************************************\
04114    under Turbo-C, sopen is defined as a macro instead a function.
04115    Since the PCTCP library uses sopen as a function call, we supply
04116    it here.
04117 \********************************************************************/
04118 
04119 #undef sopen
04120 
04121 int sopen(const char *path, int access, int shflag, int mode)
04122 {
04123    return open(path, (access) | (shflag), mode);
04124 }
04125 
04126 #endif
04127 #endif
04128 
04129 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04130 /********************************************************************\
04131 *                                                                    *
04132 *                     Tape functions                                 *
04133 *                                                                    *
04134 \********************************************************************/
04135 
04136 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04137 INT ss_tape_open(char *path, INT oflag, INT * channel)
04138 /********************************************************************\
04139 
04140   Routine: ss_tape_open
04141 
04142   Purpose: Open tape channel
04143 
04144   Input:
04145     char  *path             Name of tape
04146                             Under Windows NT, usually \\.\tape0
04147                             Under UNIX, usually /dev/tape
04148     INT   oflag             Open flags, same as open()
04149 
04150   Output:
04151     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04152 
04153   Function value:
04154     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04155     SS_NO_TAPE              No tape in device
04156     SS_DEV_BUSY             Device is used by someone else
04157 
04158 \********************************************************************/
04159 {
04160 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04161    struct mtop arg;
04162 
04163    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04164 
04165    *channel = open(path, oflag, 0644);
04166 
04167    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04168 
04169    if (*channel < 0)
04170       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", strerror(errno));
04171 
04172    if (*channel < 0) {
04173       if (errno == EIO)
04174          return SS_NO_TAPE;
04175       if (errno == EBUSY)
04176          return SS_DEV_BUSY;
04177       return errno;
04178    }
04179 #ifdef MTSETBLK
04180    /* set variable block size */
04181    arg.mt_op = MTSETBLK;
04182    arg.mt_count = 0;
04183 
04184    ioctl(*channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04185 #endif                          /* MTSETBLK */
04186 
04187 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04188 
04189 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04190    INT status;
04191    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS m;
04192 
04193    *channel = (INT) CreateFile(path, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0,
04194                                0, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
04195 
04196    if (*channel == (INT) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
04197       status = GetLastError();
04198       if (status == ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION) {
04199          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "tape is used by other process");
04200          return SS_DEV_BUSY;
04201       }
04202       if (status == ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) {
04203          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "tape device \"%s\" doesn't exist", path);
04204          return SS_NO_TAPE;
04205       }
04206 
04207       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "unknown error %d", status);
04208       return status;
04209    }
04210 
04211    status = GetTapeStatus((HANDLE) (*channel));
04212    if (status == ERROR_NO_MEDIA_IN_DRIVE || status == ERROR_BUS_RESET) {
04213       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_open", "no media in drive");
04214       return SS_NO_TAPE;
04215    }
04216 
04217    /* set block size */
04218    memset(&m, 0, sizeof(m));
04219    m.BlockSize = TAPE_BUFFER_SIZE;
04220    SetTapeParameters((HANDLE) (*channel), SET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &m);
04221 
04222 #endif
04223 
04224    return SS_SUCCESS;
04225 }
04226 
04227 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04228 INT ss_tape_close(INT channel)
04229 /********************************************************************\
04230 
04231   Routine: ss_tape_close
04232 
04233   Purpose: Close tape channel
04234 
04235   Input:
04236     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04237 
04238   Output:
04239     <none>
04240 
04241   Function value:
04242     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04243     errno                   Low level error number
04244 
04245 \********************************************************************/
04246 {
04247    INT status;
04248 
04249 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04250 
04251    status = close(channel);
04252 
04253    if (status < 0) {
04254       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_close", strerror(errno));
04255       return errno;
04256    }
04257 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04258 
04259 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04260 
04261    if (!CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel)) {
04262       status = GetLastError();
04263       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_close", "unknown error %d", status);
04264       return status;
04265    }
04266 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04267 
04268    return SS_SUCCESS;
04269 }
04270 
04271 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04272 INT ss_tape_status(char *path)
04273 /********************************************************************\
04274 
04275   Routine: ss_tape_status
04276 
04277   Purpose: Print status information about tape
04278 
04279   Input:
04280     char  *path             Name of tape
04281 
04282   Output:
04283     <print>                 Tape information
04284 
04285   Function value:
04286     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04287 
04288 \********************************************************************/
04289 {
04290 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04291    char str[256];
04292    /* let 'mt' do the job */
04293    sprintf(str, "mt -f %s status", path);
04294    system(str);
04295 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04296 
04297 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04298    INT status, channel;
04299    DWORD size;
04300    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS m;
04301    TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS d;
04302    double x;
04303 
04304    channel = (INT) CreateFile(path, GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE, 0,
04305                               0, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
04306 
04307    if (channel == (INT) INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
04308       status = GetLastError();
04309       if (status == ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION) {
04310          cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "tape is used by other process");
04311          return SS_SUCCESS;
04312       }
04313       if (status == ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND) {
04314          cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "tape device \"%s\" doesn't exist", path);
04315          return SS_SUCCESS;
04316       }
04317 
04318       cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "unknown error %d", status);
04319       return status;
04320    }
04321 
04322    /* poll media changed messages */
04323    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04324    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04325 
04326    status = GetTapeStatus((HANDLE) channel);
04327    if (status == ERROR_NO_MEDIA_IN_DRIVE || status == ERROR_BUS_RESET) {
04328       cm_msg(MINFO, "ss_tape_status", "no media in drive");
04329       CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel);
04330       return SS_SUCCESS;
04331    }
04332 
04333    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04334    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &size, &m);
04335 
04336    printf("Hardware error correction is %s\n", d.ECC ? "on" : "off");
04337    printf("Hardware compression is %s\n", d.Compression ? "on" : "off");
04338    printf("Tape %s write protected\n", m.WriteProtected ? "is" : "is not");
04339 
04340    if (d.FeaturesLow & TAPE_DRIVE_TAPE_REMAINING) {
04341       x = ((double) m.Remaining.LowPart + (double) m.Remaining.HighPart * 4.294967295E9)
04342           / 1024.0 / 1000.0;
04343       printf("Tape capacity remaining is %d MB\n", (int) x);
04344    } else
04345       printf("Tape capacity is not reported by tape\n");
04346 
04347    CloseHandle((HANDLE) channel);
04348 
04349 #endif
04350 
04351    return SS_SUCCESS;
04352 }
04353 
04354 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04355 INT ss_tape_write(INT channel, void *pdata, INT count)
04356 /********************************************************************\
04357 
04358   Routine: ss_tape_write
04359 
04360   Purpose: Write count bytes to tape channel
04361 
04362   Input:
04363     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04364     void  *pdata            Address of data to write
04365     INT   count             number of bytes
04366 
04367   Output:
04368     <none>
04369 
04370   Function value:
04371     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04372     SS_IO_ERROR             Physical IO error
04373     SS_TAPE_ERROR           Unknown tape error
04374 
04375 \********************************************************************/
04376 {
04377 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04378    INT status;
04379 
04380    do {
04381       status = write(channel, pdata, count);
04382 /*
04383     if (status != count)
04384       printf("count: %d - %d\n", count, status);
04385 */
04386    } while (status == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04387 
04388    if (status != count) {
04389       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write", strerror(errno));
04390 
04391       if (errno == EIO)
04392          return SS_IO_ERROR;
04393       else
04394          return SS_TAPE_ERROR;
04395    }
04396 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04397 
04398 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04399    INT status;
04400    DWORD written;
04401 
04402    WriteFile((HANDLE) channel, pdata, count, &written, NULL);
04403    if (written != (DWORD) count) {
04404       status = GetLastError();
04405       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write", "error %d", status);
04406 
04407       return SS_IO_ERROR;
04408    }
04409 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04410 
04411    return SS_SUCCESS;
04412 }
04413 
04414 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04415 INT ss_tape_read(INT channel, void *pdata, INT * count)
04416 /********************************************************************\
04417 
04418   Routine: ss_tape_write
04419 
04420   Purpose: Read count bytes to tape channel
04421 
04422   Input:
04423     INT   channel           Channel identifier
04424     void  *pdata            Address of data
04425     INT   *count            Number of bytes to read
04426 
04427   Output:
04428     INT   *count            Number of read
04429 
04430   Function value:
04431     SS_SUCCESS              Successful operation
04432     <errno>                 Error code
04433 
04434 \********************************************************************/
04435 {
04436 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04437    INT n, status;
04438 
04439    do {
04440       n = read(channel, pdata, *count);
04441    } while (n == -1 && errno == EINTR);
04442 
04443    if (n == -1) {
04444       if (errno == ENOSPC || errno == EIO)
04445          status = SS_END_OF_TAPE;
04446       else {
04447          if (n == 0 && errno == 0)
04448             status = SS_END_OF_FILE;
04449          else {
04450             cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_read",
04451                    "unexpected tape error: n=%d, errno=%d\n", n, errno);
04452             status = errno;
04453          }
04454       }
04455    } else
04456       status = SS_SUCCESS;
04457    *count = n;
04458 
04459    return status;
04460 
04461 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
04462 
04463    INT status;
04464    DWORD read;
04465 
04466    if (!ReadFile((HANDLE) channel, pdata, *count, &read, NULL)) {
04467       status = GetLastError();
04468       if (status == ERROR_NO_DATA_DETECTED)
04469          status = SS_END_OF_TAPE;
04470       else if (status == ERROR_FILEMARK_DETECTED)
04471          status = SS_END_OF_FILE;
04472       else if (status == ERROR_MORE_DATA)
04473          status = SS_SUCCESS;
04474       else
04475          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_read",
04476                 "unexpected tape error: n=%d, errno=%d\n", read, status);
04477    } else
04478       status = SS_SUCCESS;
04479 
04480    *count = read;
04481    return status;
04482 
04483 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
04484 
04485    return SS_SUCCESS;
04486 
04487 #endif
04488 }
04489 
04490 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04491 INT ss_tape_write_eof(INT channel)
04492 /********************************************************************\
04493 
04494   Routine: ss_tape_write_eof
04495 
04496   Purpose: Write end-of-file to tape channel
04497 
04498   Input:
04499     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04500 
04501   Output:
04502     <none>
04503 
04504   Function value:
04505     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04506     errno                   Error number
04507 
04508 \********************************************************************/
04509 {
04510    INT status;
04511 
04512 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04513    struct mtop arg;
04514 
04515    arg.mt_op = MTWEOF;
04516    arg.mt_count = 1;
04517 
04518    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04519 
04520    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04521 
04522    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04523 
04524    if (status < 0) {
04525       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", strerror(errno));
04526       return errno;
04527    }
04528 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04529 
04530 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04531 
04532    TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS d;
04533    DWORD size;
04534 
04535    size = sizeof(TAPE_GET_DRIVE_PARAMETERS);
04536    GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_DRIVE_INFORMATION, &size, &d);
04537 
04538    if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_FILEMARKS)
04539       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
04540    else if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_LONG_FMKS)
04541       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_LONG_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
04542    else if (d.FeaturesHigh & TAPE_DRIVE_WRITE_SHORT_FMKS)
04543       status = WriteTapemark((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SHORT_FILEMARKS, 1, FALSE);
04544    else
04545       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", "tape doesn't support writing of filemarks");
04546 
04547    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
04548       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_write_eof", "unknown error %d", status);
04549       return status;
04550    }
04551 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04552 
04553    return SS_SUCCESS;
04554 }
04555 
04556 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04557 INT ss_tape_fskip(INT channel, INT count)
04558 /********************************************************************\
04559 
04560   Routine: ss_tape_fskip
04561 
04562   Purpose: Skip count number of files on a tape
04563 
04564   Input:
04565     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04566     INT   count             Number of files to skip
04567 
04568   Output:
04569     <none>
04570 
04571   Function value:
04572     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04573     errno                   Error number
04574 
04575 \********************************************************************/
04576 {
04577    INT status;
04578 
04579 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04580    struct mtop arg;
04581 
04582    if (count > 0)
04583       arg.mt_op = MTFSF;
04584    else
04585       arg.mt_op = MTBSF;
04586    arg.mt_count = abs(count);
04587 
04588    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04589 
04590    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04591 
04592    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04593 
04594    if (status < 0) {
04595       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_fskip", strerror(errno));
04596       return errno;
04597    }
04598 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04599 
04600 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04601 
04602    status = SetTapePosition((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SPACE_FILEMARKS, 0,
04603                             (DWORD) count, 0, FALSE);
04604 
04605    if (status == ERROR_END_OF_MEDIA)
04606       return SS_END_OF_TAPE;
04607 
04608    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
04609       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_fskip", "error %d", status);
04610       return status;
04611    }
04612 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04613 
04614    return SS_SUCCESS;
04615 }
04616

04619 /********************************************************************\
04620 
04621   Routine: ss_tape_rskip
04622 
04623   Purpose: Skip count number of records on a tape
04624 
04625   Input:
04626     INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04627     INT   count             Number of records to skip
04628 
04629   Output:

04631 
04632   Function value:
04633     SS_SUCCESS              Successful completion
04634     errno                   Error number
04635 
04636 \********************************************************************/
04637 {
04638    INT status;
04639 
04640 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04641    struct mtop arg;
04642 
04643    if (count > 0)
04644       arg.mt_op = MTFSR;
04645    else
04646       arg.mt_op = MTBSR;
04647    arg.mt_count = abs(count);
04648 
04649    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04650 
04651    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04652 
04653    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04654 
04655    if (status < 0) {
04656       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_rskip", strerror(errno));
04657       return errno;
04658    }
04659 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */

04662 
04663    status =
04664        SetTapePosition((HANDLE) channel, TAPE_SPACE_RELATIVE_BLOCKS, 0,
04665                        (DWORD) count, 0, FALSE);
04666    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
04667       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_rskip", "error %d", status);
04668       return status;
04669    }
04670 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04671 
04672    return CM_SUCCESS;
04673 }

04730 
04731   Routine: ss_tape_spool
04732

04754 #else
04755    arg.mt_op = MTSEOD;
04756 #endif
04757    arg.mt_count = 0;
04758 
04759    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04760 
04761    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04762 
04763    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04764 
04765    if (status < 0) {
04766       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_rewind", strerror(errno));
04767       return errno;
04768    }
04769 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
04770 
04771 #ifdef OS_WINNT
04772

04775       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_spool", "error %d", status);
04776       return status;
04777    }
04778 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04779 
04780    return CM_SUCCESS;
04781 }

04786

04788

04790

04812 #endif

04814

04816 
04817    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCTOP, &arg);
04818 
04819    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04820

04822       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_mount", strerror(errno));
04823       return errno;

04830    if (status != NO_ERROR) {
04831       cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_mount", "error %d", status);
04832       return status;
04833    }
04834 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
04835 
04836    return CM_SUCCESS;
04837 }

04895 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04896 INT ss_tape_get_blockn(INT channel)
04897 /********************************************************************\
04898 Routine: ss_tape_get_blockn
04899 Purpose: Ask the tape channel for the present block number
04900 Input:
04901 INT   *channel          Channel identifier
04902 Function value:
04903 blockn:  >0 = block number, =0 option not available, <0 errno
04904 \********************************************************************/
04905 {
04906   return 0;
04907 
04908 #if defined(OS_DARWIN)
04909 
04910    return 0;
04911 
04912 #elif defined(OS_UNIX)
04913 
04914    INT status;
04915    struct mtpos arg;
04916 
04917    cm_enable_watchdog(FALSE);
04918    status = ioctl(channel, MTIOCPOS, &arg);
04919    cm_enable_watchdog(TRUE);
04920    if (status < 0) {
04921       if (errno == EIO)
04922          return 0;
04923       else {
04924          cm_msg(MERROR, "ss_tape_get_blockn", strerror(errno));
04925          return -errno;
04926       }
04927    }
04928    return (arg.mt_blkno);
04929 
04930 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
04931 
04932    INT status;
04933    TAPE_GET_MEDIA_PARAMETERS media;
04934    unsigned long size;
04935    /* I'm not sure the partition count corresponds to the block count */
04936    status =
04937        GetTapeParameters((HANDLE) channel, GET_TAPE_MEDIA_INFORMATION, &size, &media);
04938    return (media.PartitionCount);
04939 
04940 #endif
04941 }
