04944 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04945 /********************************************************************\
04946 *                                                                    *
04947 *                     Disk functions                                 *
04948 *                                                                    *
04949 \********************************************************************/
04950 
04951 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
04952 double ss_disk_free(char *path)
04953 /********************************************************************\
04954 
04955   Routine: ss_disk_free
04956 
04957   Purpose: Return free disk space
04958 
04959   Input:
04960     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
04961 
04962   Output:
04963 
04964   Function value:
04965     doube                   Number of bytes free on disk
04966 
04967 \********************************************************************/
04968 {
04969 #ifdef OS_UNIX
04970 #if defined(OS_OSF1)
04971    struct statfs st;
04972    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(st));
04973    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
04974 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
04975    struct statfs st;
04976    statfs(path, &st);
04977    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
04978 #elif defined(OS_SOLARIS)
04979    struct statvfs st;
04980    statvfs(path, &st);
04981    return (double) st.f_bavail * st.f_bsize;
04982 #elif defined(OS_IRIX)
04983    struct statfs st;
04984    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(struct statfs), 0);
04985    return (double) st.f_bfree * st.f_bsize;
04986 #else
04987    struct fs_data st;
04988    statfs(path, &st);
04989    return (double) st.fd_otsize * st.fd_bfree;
04990 #endif
04991 
04992 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
04993    DWORD SectorsPerCluster;
04994    DWORD BytesPerSector;
04995    DWORD NumberOfFreeClusters;
04996    DWORD TotalNumberOfClusters;
04997    char str[80];
04998 
04999    strcpy(str, path);
05000    if (strchr(str, ':') != NULL) {
05001       *(strchr(str, ':') + 1) = 0;
05002       strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
05003       GetDiskFreeSpace(str, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector,
05004                        &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05005    } else
05006       GetDiskFreeSpace(NULL, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector,
05007                        &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05008 
05009    return (double) NumberOfFreeClusters *SectorsPerCluster * BytesPerSector;
05010 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
05011 
05012    return 1e9;
05013 
05014 #endif
05015 }
05016 
05017 #if defined(OS_ULTRIX) || defined(OS_WINNT)
05018 int fnmatch(const char *pat, const char *str, const int flag)
05019 {
05020    while (*str != '\0') {
05021       if (*pat == '*') {
05022          pat++;
05023          if ((str = strchr(str, *pat)) == NULL)
05024             return -1;
05025       }
05026       if (*pat == *str) {
05027          pat++;
05028          str++;
05029       } else
05030          return -1;
05031    }
05032    if (*pat == '\0')
05033       return 0;
05034    else
05035       return -1;
05036 }
05037 #endif
05038 
05039 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05040 HANDLE pffile;
05041 LPWIN32_FIND_DATA lpfdata;
05042 #endif
05043 INT ss_file_find(char *path, char *pattern, char **plist)
05044 /********************************************************************\
05045 
05046   Routine: ss_file_find
05047 
05048   Purpose: Return list of files matching 'pattern' from the 'path' location
05049 
05050   Input:
05051     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05052     char  *pattern          pattern string (wildcard allowed)
05053 
05054   Output:
05055     char  **plist           pointer to the lfile list
05056 
05057   Function value:
05058     int                     Number of files matching request
05059 
05060 \********************************************************************/
05061 {
05062    int i;
05063 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05064    DIR *dir_pointer;
05065    struct dirent *dp;
05066 
05067    if ((dir_pointer = opendir(path)) == NULL)
05068       return 0;
05069    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05070    i = 0;
05071    for (dp = readdir(dir_pointer); dp != NULL; dp = readdir(dir_pointer)) {
05072       if (fnmatch(pattern, dp->d_name, 0) == 0) {
05073          *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05074          strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), dp->d_name, strlen(dp->d_name));
05075          *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(dp->d_name)) = '\0';
05076          i++;
05077          seekdir(dir_pointer, telldir(dir_pointer));
05078       }
05079    }
05080    closedir(dir_pointer);
05081 #endif
05082 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05083    char str[255];
05084    int first;
05085 
05086    strcpy(str, path);
05087    strcat(str, "\\");
05088    strcat(str, pattern);
05089    first = 1;
05090    i = 0;
05091    lpfdata = (WIN32_FIND_DATA *) malloc(sizeof(WIN32_FIND_DATA));
05092    *plist = (char *) malloc(MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05093    pffile = FindFirstFile(str, lpfdata);
05094    if (pffile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE)
05095       return 0;
05096    first = 0;
05097    *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05098    strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName,
05099            strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05100    *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05101    i++;
05102    while (FindNextFile(pffile, lpfdata)) {
05103       *plist = (char *) realloc(*plist, (i + 1) * MAX_STRING_LENGTH);
05104       strncpy(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH), lpfdata->cFileName,
05105               strlen(lpfdata->cFileName));
05106       *(*plist + (i * MAX_STRING_LENGTH) + strlen(lpfdata->cFileName)) = '\0';
05107       i++;
05108    }
05109    free(lpfdata);
05110 #endif
05111    return i;
05112 }
05113 
05114 INT ss_file_remove(char *path)
05115 /********************************************************************\
05116 
05117   Routine: ss_file_remove
05118 
05119   Purpose: remove (delete) file given through the path
05120 
05121   Input:
05122     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05123 
05124   Output:
05125 
05126   Function value:
05127     int                     function error 0= ok, -1 check errno
05128 
05129 \********************************************************************/
05130 {
05131    return remove(path);
05132 }
05133 
05134 double ss_file_size(char *path)
05135 /********************************************************************\
05136 
05137   Routine: ss_file_size
05138 
05139   Purpose: Return file size in bytes for the given path
05140 
05141   Input:
05142     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05143 
05144   Output:
05145 
05146   Function value:
05147     double                     File size
05148 
05149 \********************************************************************/
05150 {
05151    struct stat stat_buf;
05152 
05153    /* allocate buffer with file size */
05154    stat(path, &stat_buf);
05155    double size = 1.0*((unsigned long int)stat_buf.st_size);
05156    //printf("file [%s] size [%lu] [%f]\n",path,stat_buf.st_size,size);
05157    //return (double) stat_buf.st_size;
05158    return size;
05159 }
05160 
05161 double ss_disk_size(char *path)
05162 /********************************************************************\
05163 
05164   Routine: ss_disk_size
05165 
05166   Purpose: Return full disk space
05167 
05168   Input:
05169     char  *path             Name of a file in file system to check
05170 
05171   Output:
05172 
05173   Function value:
05174     doube                   Number of bytes free on disk
05175 
05176 \********************************************************************/
05177 {
05178 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05179 #if defined(OS_OSF1)
05180    struct statfs st;
05181    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(st));
05182    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_fsize;
05183 #elif defined(OS_LINUX)
05184    struct statfs st;
05185    statfs(path, &st);
05186    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05187 #elif defined(OS_SOLARIS)
05188    struct statvfs st;
05189    statvfs(path, &st);
05190    if (st.f_frsize > 0)
05191       return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_frsize;
05192    else
05193       return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05194 #elif defined(OS_ULTRIX)
05195    struct fs_data st;
05196    statfs(path, &st);
05197    return (double) st.fd_btot * 1024;
05198 #elif defined(OS_IRIX)
05199    struct statfs st;
05200    statfs(path, &st, sizeof(struct statfs), 0);
05201    return (double) st.f_blocks * st.f_bsize;
05202 #else
05203 #error ss_disk_size not defined for this OS
05204 #endif
05205 #endif                          /* OS_UNIX */
05206 
05207 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05208    DWORD SectorsPerCluster;
05209    DWORD BytesPerSector;
05210    DWORD NumberOfFreeClusters;
05211    DWORD TotalNumberOfClusters;
05212    char str[80];
05213 
05214    strcpy(str, path);
05215    if (strchr(str, ':') != NULL) {
05216       *(strchr(str, ':') + 1) = 0;
05217       strcat(str, DIR_SEPARATOR_STR);
05218       GetDiskFreeSpace(str, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector,
05219                        &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05220    } else
05221       GetDiskFreeSpace(NULL, &SectorsPerCluster, &BytesPerSector,
05222                        &NumberOfFreeClusters, &TotalNumberOfClusters);
05223 
05224    return (double) TotalNumberOfClusters *SectorsPerCluster * BytesPerSector;
05225 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05226 
05227    return 1e9;
05228 }
05229 
05230 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05231 /********************************************************************\
05232 *                                                                    *
05233 *                  Screen  functions                                 *
05234 *                                                                    *
05235 \********************************************************************/
05236 
05237 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05238 void ss_clear_screen()
05239 /********************************************************************\
05240 
05241   Routine: ss_clear_screen
05242 
05243   Purpose: Clear the screen
05244 
05245   Input:
05246     <none>
05247 
05248   Output:
05249     <none>
05250 
05251   Function value:
05252     <none>
05253 
05254 \********************************************************************/
05255 {
05256 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05257 
05258    HANDLE hConsole;
05259    COORD coordScreen = { 0, 0 };        /* here's where we'll home the cursor */
05260    BOOL bSuccess;
05261    DWORD cCharsWritten;
05262    CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO csbi;     /* to get buffer info */
05263    DWORD dwConSize;             /* number of character cells in the current buffer */
05264 
05265    hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
05266 
05267    /* get the number of character cells in the current buffer */
05268    bSuccess = GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo(hConsole, &csbi);
05269    dwConSize = csbi.dwSize.X * csbi.dwSize.Y;
05270 
05271    /* fill the entire screen with blanks */
05272    bSuccess = FillConsoleOutputCharacter(hConsole, (TCHAR) ' ',
05273                                          dwConSize, coordScreen, &cCharsWritten);
05274 
05275    /* put the cursor at (0, 0) */
05276    bSuccess = SetConsoleCursorPosition(hConsole, coordScreen);
05277    return;
05278 
05279 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05280 #if defined(OS_UNIX) || defined(OS_VXWORKS) || defined(OS_VMS)
05281    printf("\033[2J");
05282 #endif
05283 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
05284    clrscr();
05285 #endif
05286 }

05316 
05317 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05318 }

05320 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05321 void ss_printf(INT x, INT y, const char *format, ...)
05322 /********************************************************************\
05323 
05324   Routine: ss_printf
05325 
05326   Purpose: Print string at given cursor position
05327 
05328   Input:
05329     INT   x,y               Cursor position, starting from zero,
05330           x=0 and y=0 left upper corner
05331 
05332     char  *format           Format string for printf
05333     ...                     Arguments for printf
05334 
05335   Output:
05336     <none>
05337 
05338   Function value:
05339     <none>
05340 
05341 \********************************************************************/
05342 {
05343    char str[256];
05344    va_list argptr;
05345 
05346    va_start(argptr, format);
05347    vsprintf(str, (char *) format, argptr);
05348    va_end(argptr);
05349 
05350 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05351    {
05352       HANDLE hConsole;
05353       COORD dwWriteCoord;
05354       DWORD cCharsWritten;
05355 
05356       hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
05357 
05358       dwWriteCoord.X = (short) x;
05359       dwWriteCoord.Y = (short) y;
05360 
05361       WriteConsoleOutputCharacter(hConsole, str, strlen(str),
05362                                   dwWriteCoord, &cCharsWritten);
05363    }
05364 
05365 #endif                          /* OS_WINNT */
05366 
05367 #if defined(OS_UNIX) || defined(OS_VXWORKS) || defined(OS_VMS)
05368    printf("\033[%1d;%1d;H", y + 1, x + 1);
05369    printf(str);
05370    fflush(stdout);
05371 #endif
05372 
05373 #ifdef OS_MSDOS
05374    gotoxy(x + 1, y + 1);
05375    cputs(str);
05376 #endif
05377 }

05379 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05380 char *ss_getpass(char *prompt)
05381 /********************************************************************\
05382 
05383   Routine: ss_getpass
05384 
05385   Purpose: Read password without echoing it at the screen
05386 
05387   Input:
05388     char   *prompt    Prompt string
05389 
05390   Output:
05391     <none>
05392 
05393   Function value:
05394     char*             Pointer to password
05395 
05396 \********************************************************************/
05397 {
05398    static char password[32];
05399 
05400    printf(prompt);
05401    memset(password, 0, sizeof(password));
05402 
05403 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05404    return (char *) getpass("");
05405 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
05406    {
05407       HANDLE hConsole;
05408       DWORD nCharsRead;
05409 
05410       hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
05411       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT);
05412       ReadConsole(hConsole, password, sizeof(password), &nCharsRead, NULL);
05413       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT | ENABLE_ECHO_INPUT |
05414                      ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT | ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT);
05415       printf("\n");
05416 
05417       if (password[strlen(password) - 1] == '\r')
05418          password[strlen(password) - 1] = 0;
05419 
05420       return password;
05421    }
05422 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
05423    {
05424       char c, *ptr;
05425 
05426       ptr = password;
05427       while ((c = getchar()) != EOF && c != '\n')
05428          *ptr++ = c;
05429       *ptr = 0;
05430 
05431       printf("\n");
05432       return password;
05433    }
05434 #else
05435    {
05436       ss_gets(password, 32);
05437       return password;
05438    }
05439 #endif
05440 }
05441 
05442 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05443 INT ss_getchar(BOOL reset)
05444 /********************************************************************\
05445 
05446   Routine: ss_getchar
05447 
05448   Purpose: Read a single character
05449 
05450   Input:
05451     BOOL   reset            Reset terminal to standard mode
05452 
05453   Output:
05454     <none>
05455 
05456   Function value:
05457     int             0       for no character available
05458                     CH_xxs  for special character
05459                     n       ASCII code for normal character
05460                     -1      function not available on this OS
05461 
05462 \********************************************************************/
05463 {
05464 #ifdef OS_UNIX
05465 
05466    static BOOL init = FALSE;
05467    static struct termios save_termios;
05468    struct termios buf;
05469    int i, fd;
05470    char c[3];
05471 
05472    if (_daemon_flag)
05473       return 0;
05474 
05475    fd = fileno(stdin);
05476 
05477    if (reset) {
05478       if (init)
05479          tcsetattr(fd, TCSAFLUSH, &save_termios);
05480       init = FALSE;
05481       return 0;
05482    }
05483 
05484    if (!init) {
05485       tcgetattr(fd, &save_termios);
05486       memcpy(&buf, &save_termios, sizeof(buf));
05487 
05488       buf.c_lflag &= ~(ECHO | ICANON | IEXTEN);
05489 
05490       buf.c_iflag &= ~(ICRNL | INPCK | ISTRIP | IXON);
05491 
05492       buf.c_cflag &= ~(CSIZE | PARENB);
05493       buf.c_cflag |= CS8;
05494       /* buf.c_oflag &= ~(OPOST); */
05495       buf.c_cc[VMIN] = 0;
05496       buf.c_cc[VTIME] = 0;
05497 
05498       tcsetattr(fd, TCSAFLUSH, &buf);
05499       init = TRUE;
05500    }
05501 
05502    memset(c, 0, 3);
05503    i = read(fd, c, 1);
05504 
05505    if (i == 0)
05506       return 0;
05507 
05508    /* check if ESC */
05509    if (c[0] == 27) {
05510       i = read(fd, c, 2);
05511       if (i == 0)               /* return if only ESC */
05512          return 27;
05513 
05514       /* cursor keys return 2 chars, others 3 chars */
05515       if (c[1] < 65)
05516          read(fd, c, 1);
05517 
05518       /* convert ESC sequence to CH_xxx */
05519       switch (c[1]) {
05520       case 49:
05521          return CH_HOME;
05522       case 50:
05523          return CH_INSERT;
05524       case 51:
05525          return CH_DELETE;
05526       case 52:
05527          return CH_END;
05528       case 53:
05529          return CH_PUP;
05530       case 54:
05531          return CH_PDOWN;
05532       case 65:
05533          return CH_UP;
05534       case 66:
05535          return CH_DOWN;
05536       case 67:
05537          return CH_RIGHT;
05538       case 68:
05539          return CH_LEFT;
05540       }
05541    }
05542 
05543    /* BS/DEL -> BS */
05544    if (c[0] == 127)
05545       return CH_BS;
05546 
05547    return c[0];
05548 
05549 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)
05550 
05551    static BOOL init = FALSE;
05552    static INT repeat_count = 0;
05553    static INT repeat_char;
05554    HANDLE hConsole;
05555    DWORD nCharsRead;
05556    INPUT_RECORD ir;
05557    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
05558 
05559    /* find out if we are under W95 */
05560    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
05561    GetVersionEx(&vi);
05562 
05563    if (vi.dwPlatformId != VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
05564       /* under W95, console doesn't work properly */
05565       int c;
05566 
05567       if (!kbhit())
05568          return 0;
05569 
05570       c = getch();
05571       if (c == 224) {
05572          c = getch();
05573          switch (c) {
05574          case 71:
05575             return CH_HOME;
05576          case 72:
05577             return CH_UP;
05578          case 73:
05579             return CH_PUP;
05580          case 75:
05581             return CH_LEFT;
05582          case 77:
05583             return CH_RIGHT;
05584          case 79:
05585             return CH_END;
05586          case 80:
05587             return CH_DOWN;
05588          case 81:
05589             return CH_PDOWN;
05590          case 82:
05591             return CH_INSERT;
05592          case 83:
05593             return CH_DELETE;
05594          }
05595       }
05596       return c;
05597    }
05598 
05599    hConsole = GetStdHandle(STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
05600 
05601    if (reset) {
05602       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_LINE_INPUT | ENABLE_ECHO_INPUT |
05603                      ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT | ENABLE_MOUSE_INPUT);
05604       init = FALSE;
05605       return 0;
05606    }
05607 
05608    if (!init) {
05609       SetConsoleMode(hConsole, ENABLE_PROCESSED_INPUT);
05610       init = TRUE;
05611    }
05612 
05613    if (repeat_count) {
05614       repeat_count--;
05615       return repeat_char;
05616    }
05617 
05618    PeekConsoleInput(hConsole, &ir, 1, &nCharsRead);
05619 
05620    if (nCharsRead == 0)
05621       return 0;
05622 
05623    ReadConsoleInput(hConsole, &ir, 1, &nCharsRead);
05624 
05625    if (ir.EventType != KEY_EVENT)
05626       return ss_getchar(0);
05627 
05628    if (!ir.Event.KeyEvent.bKeyDown)
05629       return ss_getchar(0);
05630 
05631    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.wRepeatCount > 1) {
05632       repeat_count = ir.Event.KeyEvent.wRepeatCount - 1;
05633       repeat_char = ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar;
05634       return repeat_char;
05635    }
05636 
05637    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar)
05638       return ir.Event.KeyEvent.uChar.AsciiChar;
05639 
05640    if (ir.Event.KeyEvent.dwControlKeyState & (ENHANCED_KEY)) {
05641       switch (ir.Event.KeyEvent.wVirtualKeyCode) {
05642       case 33:
05643          return CH_PUP;
05644       case 34:
05645          return CH_PDOWN;
05646       case 35:
05647          return CH_END;
05648       case 36:
05649          return CH_HOME;
05650       case 37:
05651          return CH_LEFT;
05652       case 38:
05653          return CH_UP;
05654       case 39:
05655          return CH_RIGHT;
05656       case 40:
05657          return CH_DOWN;
05658       case 45:
05659          return CH_INSERT;
05660       case 46:
05661          return CH_DELETE;
05662       }
05663 
05664       return ir.Event.KeyEvent.wVirtualKeyCode;
05665    }
05666 
05667    return ss_getchar(0);
05668 
05669 #elif defined(OS_MSDOS)
05670 
05671    int c;
05672 
05673    if (!kbhit())
05674       return 0;
05675 
05676    c = getch();
05677    if (!c) {
05678       c = getch();
05679       switch (c) {
05680       case 71:
05681          return CH_HOME;
05682       case 72:
05683          return CH_UP;
05684       case 73:
05685          return CH_PUP;
05686       case 75:
05687          return CH_LEFT;
05688       case 77:
05689          return CH_RIGHT;
05690       case 79:
05691          return CH_END;
05692       case 80:
05693          return CH_DOWN;
05694       case 81:
05695          return CH_PDOWN;
05696       case 82:
05697          return CH_INSERT;
05698       case 83:
05699          return CH_DELETE;
05700       }
05701    }
05702    return c;
05703 
05704 #else
05705    return -1;
05706 #endif
05707 }
05708 
05709 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05710 char *ss_gets(char *string, int size)
05711 /********************************************************************\
05712 
05713   Routine: ss_gets
05714 
05715   Purpose: Read a line from standard input. Strip trailing new line
05716            character. Return in a loop so that it cannot be interrupted
05717            by an alarm() signal (like under Sun Solaris)
05718 
05719   Input:
05720     INT    size             Size of string
05721 
05722   Output:
05723     BOOL   string           Return string
05724 
05725   Function value:
05726     char                    Return string
05727 
05728 \********************************************************************/
05729 {
05730    char *p;
05731 
05732    do {
05733       p = fgets(string, size, stdin);
05734    } while (p == NULL);
05735 
05736 
05737    if (strlen(p) > 0 && p[strlen(p) - 1] == '\n')
05738       p[strlen(p) - 1] = 0;
05739 
05740    return p;
05741 }

05743 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05744 /********************************************************************\
05745 *                                                                    *
05746 *                  Direct IO functions                               *
05747 *                                                                    *
05748 \********************************************************************/
05749 
05750 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05751 INT ss_directio_give_port(INT start, INT end)
05752 {
05753 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05754 
05755    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to open ports */
05756 
05757    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
05758    HANDLE hdio = 0;
05759    DWORD buffer[] = { 6, 0, 0, 0 };
05760    DWORD size;
05761 
05762    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
05763    GetVersionEx(&vi);
05764 
05765    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
05766    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
05767       hdio =
05768           CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ,
05769                      NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
05770       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
05771          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
05772          return -1;
05773       }
05774 
05775       /* open ports */
05776       buffer[1] = start;
05777       buffer[2] = end;
05778       if (!DeviceIoControl
05779           (hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
05780          return -1;
05781    }
05782 
05783    return SS_SUCCESS;
05784 #else
05785    return SS_SUCCESS;
05786 #endif
05787 }
05788 
05789 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05790 INT ss_directio_lock_port(INT start, INT end)
05791 {
05792 #ifdef OS_WINNT
05793 
05794    /* under Windows NT, use DirectIO driver to lock ports */
05795 
05796    OSVERSIONINFO vi;
05797    HANDLE hdio;
05798    DWORD buffer[] = { 7, 0, 0, 0 };
05799    DWORD size;
05800 
05801    vi.dwOSVersionInfoSize = sizeof(OSVERSIONINFO);
05802    GetVersionEx(&vi);
05803 
05804    /* use DirectIO driver under NT to gain port access */
05805    if (vi.dwPlatformId == VER_PLATFORM_WIN32_NT) {
05806       hdio =
05807           CreateFile("\\\\.\\directio", GENERIC_READ, FILE_SHARE_READ,
05808                      NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, 0, NULL);
05809       if (hdio == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE) {
05810          printf("hyt1331.c: Cannot access IO ports (No DirectIO driver installed)\n");
05811          return -1;
05812       }
05813 
05814       /* lock ports */
05815       buffer[1] = start;
05816       buffer[2] = end;
05817       if (!DeviceIoControl
05818           (hdio, (DWORD) 0x9c406000, &buffer, sizeof(buffer), NULL, 0, &size, NULL))
05819          return -1;
05820    }
05821 
05822    return SS_SUCCESS;
05823 #else
05824    return SS_SUCCESS;
05825 #endif
05826 }

05836 INT ss_syslog(const char *message)
05837 /********************************************************************\
05838 
05839   Routine: ss_syslog
05840 
05841   Purpose: Write a message to the system logging facility
05842 
05843   Input:
05844     char   format  Same as for printf
05845 
05846   Output:
05847     <none>
05848

05850     SS_SUCCESS     Successful completion

05852 \********************************************************************/

05855    static BOOL init = FALSE;
05856 
05857    if (!init) {
05858 #ifdef OS_ULTRIX
05859       openlog("MIDAS", LOG_PID);
05860 #else
05861       openlog("MIDAS", LOG_PID, LOG_USER);
05862 #endif
05863       init = TRUE;
05864    }
05865 
05866    syslog(LOG_DEBUG, message);
05867    return SS_SUCCESS;
05868 #elif defined(OS_WINNT)         /* OS_UNIX */
05869 /*
05870 HANDLE hlog = 0;
05871 const char *pstr[2];
05872 
05873   if (!hlog)
05874     {
05875     HKEY  hk;
05876     DWORD d;
05877     char  str[80];
05878 
05879     RegCreateKey(HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE,
05880       "SYSTEM\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\EventLog\\Application\\Midas", &hk);
05881 
05882     strcpy(str, (char *) rpc_get_server_option(RPC_OSERVER_NAME));
05883     RegSetValueEx(hk, "EventMessageFile", 0, REG_EXPAND_SZ, (LPBYTE) str, strlen(str) + 1);
05884 
05885     d = EVENTLOG_ERROR_TYPE | EVENTLOG_WARNING_TYPE |
05886         EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE;
05887     RegSetValueEx(hk, "TypesSupported", 0, REG_DWORD, (LPBYTE) &d, sizeof(DWORD));
05888     RegCloseKey(hk);
05889 
05890     hlog = RegisterEventSource(NULL, "Midas");
05891     }
05892 
05893   pstr[0] = message;
05894   pstr[1] = NULL;
05895 
05896   if (hlog)
05897     ReportEvent(hlog, EVENTLOG_INFORMATION_TYPE, 0, 0, NULL, 1, 0, pstr, NULL);
05898 */
05899    return SS_SUCCESS;
05900 
05901 #else                           /* OS_WINNT */
05902 
05903    return SS_SUCCESS;
05904 
05905 #endif
05906 }
05907 
05908 /*------------------------------------------------------------------*/
05909 /********************************************************************\
05910 *                                                                    *
05911 *                  Encryption                                        *
05912 *                                                                    *
05913 \********************************************************************/
05914 
05915 #define bin_to_ascii(c) ((c)>=38?((c)-38+'a'):(c)>=12?((c)-12+'A'):(c)+'.')
05916 
05917 char *ss_crypt(char *buf, char *salt)
05918 /********************************************************************\
05919 
05920   Routine: ss_crypt
05921 
05922   Purpose: Simple fake of UNIX crypt(3) function, until we get
05923            a better one
05924 
05925   Input:
05926     char   *buf             Plain password
05927     char   *slalt           Two random characters
05928                             events. Can be used to skip events
05929 
05930   Output:
05931     <none>
05932 
05933   Function value:
05934     char*                   Encrypted password
05935 
05936 \********************************************************************/
05937 {
05938    int i, seed;
05939    static char enc_pw[13];
05940 
05941    memset(enc_pw, 0, sizeof(enc_pw));
05942    enc_pw[0] = salt[0];
05943    enc_pw[1] = salt[1];
05944 
05945    for (i = 0; i < 8 && buf[i]; i++)
05946       enc_pw[i + 2] = buf[i];
05947    for (; i < 8; i++)
05948       enc_pw[i + 2] = 0;
05949 
05950    seed = 123;
05951    for (i = 2; i < 13; i++) {
05952       seed = 5 * seed + 27 + enc_pw[i];
05953       enc_pw[i] = (char) bin_to_ascii(seed & 0x3F);
05954    }
05955 
05956    return enc_pw;
05957 }
05958 
05960 #endif                          /* DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS */
05961  /* end of msfunctionc */ /* end of msystemincludecode */
